0Integration/The%20Top%207%20Free%20Alternatives%20to%20Adobe%20Illustrator%20of%202021-4.png?width=650&name=The%20Top%207%20Free%20Alternatives%20to%20Adobe%20Illustrator%20of%202021-4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn26@2020_3/2021/07/12/18-35-53-363_3cb044a478207f03.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/The%20Top%207%20Free%20Alternatives%20to%20Adobe%20Illustrator%20of%202021.png?width=650&name=The%20Top%207%20Free%20Alternatives%20to%20Adobe%20Illustrator%20of%202021.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn33@2020_3/2021/07/12/18-35-53-571_e08e8ada4d6d8241.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/30da96db-0967-4f26-b865-5aa4728dfe4f.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn46@2020_6/2021/07/12/18-35-50-803_59c208bd44cc3f7b.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fadobe-free-alternatives&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn18@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-52-549_e3eac56e41483883.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938150},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"How to Write an Introduction: A Simplified Guide","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-write-introduction-quick-tip-ht","description":"<p>You only get one chance to make a first impression on your website or blog — which means you need an introduction that stands out. But what do you say? How do you say it? Should it be long? Short? Funny? Serious?<br><br>For many of us, the stress of <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/write-stronger-introductions\">creating a great introduction</a> drives the dreaded cursor feedback loop: Blink. Blink. Blink. The cursor-on-a-blank-screen sits, waiting for your brilliance but you just can’t find the words. It’s something that all writers — amateur or professional, aspiring or experienced — know and dread. And of all times for it to occur, it seems to plague us the most when trying to write an introduction.</p>  \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=ccc95db5-9007-49cf-b69c-94bb5c46b366&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Download Now: 6 Free Blog Post Templates\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/ccc95db5-9007-49cf-b69c-94bb5c46b366.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>I mean, you already have a blog post you want to write. Can't you just dive in and write it? Why all the focus on getting the introduction right?</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Here's the thing: Intros set the stage. They establish the tone and let visitors know what to expect.</p> \n<p>And it’s not all bad — introductions don’t have to be long or complex. In fact, most people prefer them to be quite quick. They also don't have to be so difficult.</p> \n<p>Let's break down exactly how to write an introduction that's short, effective, and relatively painless. And if you're ever having trouble churning out those intros, come back here and re-read this formula to lift yourself out of that writing rut.</p> \n<div> \n <p></p> \n <p></p> \n <h2>How to Write an Introduction</h2> \n</div> \n<p>Writing an introduction that captures your audience can help your website traffic (and ultimately, your business) grow better, but doing it right is just as important. Here's how to write an introduction in three simple steps.</p> \n<p>To write an introduction, be mindful of what it's supposed to achieve. The main goals here are to draw in your reader — a relative stranger, most of the time — and concisely let her know what the article is about. Generally, that consists of three key components:</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Step 1) Grab the reader's attention. That looks different for every piece of writing, but we've provided some suggestions below.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Step 2) Present the reason for the post's existence.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Step 3) Explain how the post will help address the problem that brought your reader to it.</p> \n<p>As a lover of all things meta, I will, of course, use this post's introduction as an example of how to write an intro. It contains different components that create the above introduction \"formula,\" which you can refer to that when you get stuck with your own.</p> \n<p>Below, we've gone into more detail on each component.</p> \n<h2>Writing an Introduction Paragraph</h2> \n<h3>1. Grab the reader's attention.</h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">There are a few ways to hook your reader from the start. You can be empathetic (\"Don't you hate it when...?\"), or tell a story, so the reader immediately feels some emotional resonance with the piece. You could tell a joke (\"Ha! This is fun. Let's read more of this.\"). You could shock the reader with a crazy fact or stat (\"Whoa. That's crazy. I must know more!\").</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">For this intro, I went the \"empathetic\" route.</span></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"><img src=\"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/9XvDso-vX2G0efZ8CCgDI_EuWw4S0O261zjbM7Maza4h13bfJRwM9c40UrwSxKcTQGMgweuV6xFPPesVTGRcSuJkOqluJJsNMGJ8BjgZ8ew6xH3Q30CusxDiyZHT1V6GsXZsY-a-\" width=\"600\" alt=\"example of how to Grab the reader's attention in an introduction paragraph\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">Writer's block stinks. Blank screens and taunting cursors — the worst. Who's with me?</span></p> \n<h3>2. Present the reason for the post's existence.</h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">Your post needs to have a purpose. The purpose of this post is to address a specific problem — the pain in the butt that is writing intros. But, we have to do it, and therein lies the approach to something important: making writing introductions easier.</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">Just because you know the purpose of your post, doesn't mean the reader does — not yet, anyway. It's your job to validate your post's importance and give your audience a reason to keep reading.</span></p> \n<h3>3. Explain how the post will help address the problem.</h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">Now that the reader is presented with a problem that he or she can relate to — and obviously wants a solution — it's time to let the audience know what the post will provide, and quickly.</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">In other words, the introduction should set expectations. Take this post, for example. I <em><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">don't</span></em><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"> want the reader to dive in and expect to see a list of reasons <em><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">why</span></em><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"> introductions are important. I want you to expect to read about <em><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">what</span></em><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"> makes a good introduction. </span></span></span></span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">But if I hadn't clarified that in the introduction, you might have expected the former. After all, be honest — did you skim over or forget the title of this post already? That's okay. That's why we tell the reader exactly what the post will provide, and why it's valuable.</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">Of course, there are other valid ways to write introductions for your marketi<span style=\"color: #444444;\">ng content — don't feel the need to follow this formula for every single piece of content, as some are more casual than others. But, this guide should help provide a solid framework to follow if you're just getting started, or if it's just one of those days when the words aren't flowing.</span></span></p> \n<h4><span style=\"color: #444444;\">What makes a good introduction?</span></h4> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">While format is fundamental to consistently capture visitor attention, it’s also worth considering stylistic frameworks that can help boost engagement from the first moment users land on your site. These include:</span></p> \n<h5><span style=\"color: #444444;\">1. Telling a compelling story.</span></h5> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">Great stories sell books — and they’re also a fantastic way to open a website blog. Storytelling is part of the human experience and if your intro can tee up a solid story, visitors are more likely to keep reading past the first paragraph.</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">The caveat? Don’t give it all away up-front. Not only should intros be kept short, but the idea is to have people read all the way through to the end. Instead, start with a great hook about something interesting that happened — “The one time I…”, “It all started when…”</span></p> \n<h5><span style=\"color: #444444;\">2. Cultivating empathy.</span></h5> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">We’re also naturally predisposed to empathy, especially when we can relate to what someone else is saying on a personal level.</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">Let’s say you’re running a money-saving advice blog. By starting your post with a few of your own experiences with debt and how it impacted your life, you can cultivate empathy from those in similar positions and simultaneously lend your blog greater authority.</span></p> \n<h5><span style=\"color: #444444;\">3. Establishing common pain points.</span></h5> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">There’s no trait more universally human than complaining. We do it about small things — like the weather — and big things, like challenges at work or home. This creates an opportunity for content creators: Establish common ground with familiar pain points.</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">Consider a home maintenance and repair blog. You could introduce homeowners communally dislike — such as clogged gutters or peeling paint — quickly discuss why it’s so frustrating, and then assure readers you can offer a viable solution.</span></p> \n<h5><span style=\"color: #444444;\">4. Crafting a human connection.</span></h5> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">If you’re running any type of product or service website, expect natural skepticism from visitors. They know you’re trying to sell something and their guard is naturally up, especially against hyperbolic or superfluous claims.</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">Here, it’s worth considering calling out a company shortfall — “we’re not the best, but”, “we don’t have all the answers” — and then highlighting what sets you apart from the competition. Done right, you can disarm cynical users with honesty, craft a human connection and encourage them to consider your pitch.</span></p> \n<h5><span style=\"color: #444444;\">5. Asking interesting questions.</span></h5> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">You can never go wrong with questions — so long as they’re interesting. Intros that start with “did you know that…” or “ever wondered why…” are great starters if you have relevant information to share.</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">This can’t be overstated: If your blog doesn’t (or can’t) answer the question you pose in the introduction, choose a different approach. Nothing frustrates visitors faster than discovering that blog intro and body are a content mismatch.</span></p> \n<h2><span style=\"color: #444444;\">5 Introduction Examples</span></h2> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">Curious about what a great introduction looks like in the wild? Let’s break down five great examples.</span></p> \n<h3><span style=\"color: #444444;\">1. <a href=\"https://petapixel.com/2021/06/08/this-free-2-5-hour-tutorial-covers-all-aspects-of-wedding-photography/\">PetaPixel</a></span></h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">Photography site PetaPixel offers news, insights, and advice about all things photo-related. In their post “This Free 2.5 Hour Tutorial Covers All Aspects of Wedding Photography,” PetaPixel uses their introduction to highlight the experience of tutorial creator Taylor Jackson, who shoots “60 to 70 weddings every year.”</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">This quick-hitter introduction helps establish Jackson’s credibility as an expert and cultivates confidence among readers, in turn encouraging them to read the post and click through to the tutorial.</span></p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://www.apartmenttherapy.com/statement-home-tray-36929493\">Apartment Therapy</a></h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">Apartment Therapy is all about helping visitors organize, clean, and streamline their apartment space, while also highlighting specific product categories. In their recent post “This Unique Tray is What Your Living Room is Missing,” the site uses one of the techniques mentioned above: Pain points.</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">“Even maximalists can’t stand clutter,” reads the first intro line. “The reality is that nobody likes to open a cabinet only to be faced with a messy avalanche of knick-knacks and accessories.” By establishing common grounds for complaint, the blog helps set up the benefits of the product it’s trying to sell.</span></p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://greatist.com/happiness/home-tool-kit-essentials\">Greatist</a></h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">Greatist is a health and wellness blog that offers advice and tips for readers. Their recent starter toolkit post — “Stop Using Your Shoe as a Hammer: 17 Items for Your Starter Tool Kit” helps cultivate a connection with a simple introductory line: “You don’t have to be a DIY pro to need a tool kit around.” </span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">By highlighting the near-universal need for a simple, streamlined toolkit, the site sets up readers to continue on and discover which tools are critical for starter kits.</span></p> \n<h3><span style=\"color: #444444;\">4. <a href=\"http://www.thefriendlyteacher.com/blog\">The Friendly Teacher</a></span></h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">Educational advice site The Friendly Teacher opens her “10 Tips for Organizing Your Classroom at the End of the Year” with a simple question: “What do teachers do in the summer?”</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">The answer is easy: Relax. But as the post points out, leaving classrooms in a state of disrepair only makes more work for the following year — and she’s here to help with 10 simple tips for pre-summer cleanup. The introduction works because it helps put readers in the right frame of mind — a relaxing summer — and then offers actionable tips to reach that goal.</span></p> \n<h3><span style=\"color: #444444;\">5. <a href=\"https://bloggingtips.com/choosing-your-blog-url/\">BloggingTips.com</a></span></h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">BloggingTips.com is exactly what you’d expect: A site dedicated to useful blogging tips that help improve your site. In their recent post, “How To Choose A Blog Name – A New Blogger’s Guide to Selecting a Domain Name And URL”, they don’t waste any time getting to the point of their introduction, noting that, “Once you’ve decided to launch a blog – whether for personal or business purposes – one of the first decisions you have to make involves your domain name selection.”</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">The biggest benefit of this introduction? Brevity. It gets right to the point. If you’ve got a blog, you need a domain name. This is a great approach when the subject matter you’re tackling is relevant and useful but not inherently compelling: Rather than trying to force a connection or create a convoluted narrative, straight and to the point works best.</span></p> \n<h2>Let's Get Started</h2> \n<p><span style=\"color: #444444;\">Feeling inspired? Good. Next time you find yourself face-to-face with the dreaded blinking cursor, use these resources and compelling examples to find motivation and write <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/write-stronger-introductions\" style=\"color: #444444;\">simpler, smarter, and stronger introductions</a>.</span></p> \n<p><em><em>Editor's Note: This post was originally published in September 2013 and has been updated and for freshness, accuracy, and comprehensiveness.</em></em></p> \n<p><em><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=648420ad-1760-40e2-994f-7833315a7b7d&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\" \" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/648420ad-1760-40e2-994f-7833315a7b7d.png\"></a></em></p> \n<div></div> {cta('fb3b8e61-2ce1-4097-9a49-c423a0a54ac3')}}  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhow-to-write-introduction-quick-tip-ht&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 01 Jul 2021 10:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/ccc95db5-9007-49cf-b69c-94bb5c46b366.png","linkMd5":"aac71727d25c3427752ea329772a4fd8","destWidth":413,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5087,"destBytes":6586,"author":"brbecker@hubspot.com (Braden Becker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/ccc95db5-9007-49cf-b69c-94bb5c46b366.png":null,"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/9XvDso-vX2G0efZ8CCgDI_EuWw4S0O261zjbM7Maza4h13bfJRwM9c40UrwSxKcTQGMgweuV6xFPPesVTGRcSuJkOqluJJsNMGJ8BjgZ8ew6xH3Q30CusxDiyZHT1V6GsXZsY-a-":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn92@2020_1/2021/07/12/18-35-51-538_51d62e0ae965c6ec.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/648420ad-1760-40e2-994f-7833315a7b7d.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn85@2020_3/2021/07/12/18-35-51-996_664a85cc59c4c0d8.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhow-to-write-introduction-quick-tip-ht&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn94@2020_6/2021/07/12/18-35-49-870_7e672ba3aa275c0e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938126},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"The Ultimate Guide to Internet Marketing","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/internet-marketing","description":"<p>Internet use is increasing worldwide every day — in fact, <a href=\"https://datareportal.com/reports/digital-2021-global-overview-report#:~:text=Internet%3A%204.66%20billion%20people%20around,now%20stands%20at%2059.5%20percent.\">over 4.6 billion people</a><span style=\"font-size: 1.1rem;\"> around the world use the internet, as of 2021.</span></p>  \n<p>Marketing is, and always has been, about reaching customers where they are. TV commercials, print advertisements, and billboards all attempt to do just that.</p> \n<p>The internet offers unique benefits other marketing mediums can't offer — scope of reach, the option to personalize content, and the opportunity to build far-reaching relationships with customers, being just a few.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=aacfe6c7-71e6-4f49-979f-76099062afa0&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Download Now: Free Marketing Plan Template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/aacfe6c7-71e6-4f49-979f-76099062afa0.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p>But the internet can be an overwhelming and all-encompassing entity, filled with videos and recipes and news articles and e-commerce sites. In the crowded space of the internet, how are you supposed to differentiate your business to reach the right audience?</p> \n<p>The answer is internet marketing.</p> \n<p>Internet marketing leverages digital channels, including email, social media, websites, and search engines, to reach your ideal audience. Unlike more traditional advertising mediums, such as print, the internet encourages two-way conversations between your business and your customer, ideally creating better long-term customer retention.</p> \n<p>There's no avoiding it: internet marketing is critical for the success of your business in 2021 and beyond.</p> \n<p>But with all the gimmicks and tricks, it can be difficult to distinguish short-term wins from effective long-term strategies, which is why we've created an ultimate guide. Here, we'll cover everything from marketing strategies to real-world examples, to ensure your business reaches the right people out of that four billion.</p> \n<h2>What is Internet/Online Marketing?</h2> \n<p>Online marketing, also known as internet marketing or web advertising, is a form of marketing that uses the internet to deliver promotional messages to customers through digital channels such as search engines, email, websites, and social media.</p> \n<p>Online marketing strategies include web design, SEO, email, social media, PPC, and other internet-related methods.</p> \n<h3 style=\"font-weight: bold;\">What's the role of internet marketing?</h3> \n<p>Simply put, the role of internet marketing is to help your business reach, attract, and convert online audiences.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Let's dive into two separate goals you'll have with internet marketing, as well as the necessary methods you'll want to take to achieve those goals.</p> \n<h4>Internet Marketing to Attract New Customers</h4> \n<p>You can use online marketing strategies to attract new customers. To do this, you'll want to focus primarily on paid social media ads, search engines, and web design.</p> \n<p>For instance, you might use <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/a/lookalike-audiences\">Facebook's Lookalike Audiences</a> to get your message in front of an audience similar to your core demographic. Or, you could pay a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/influencers-social-media-experiment?_ga=2.249309317.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">social media influencer</a> to share images of your products to her already well-established community. Paid social media can attract new customers to your brand or product, but you'll want to conduct market research and A/B testing before investing too much in one social media channel.</p> \n<p>To attract new customers, you also need to maintain a powerful SEO presence. With <a href=\"https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/consumer-insights/the-changing-face-b2b-marketing/\">89% of B2B buyers</a> and <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/marketing-statistics?_ga=2.249309317.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">81% of shoppers</a> using the internet for research before making purchasing decisions, it's imperative your business is at the forefront of search for related keywords.</p> \n<p>Having a strong SEO presence also translates to more in-store purchases, as well — in fact, <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/marketing-statistics?_ga=2.249309317.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">78% of local mobile searches</a> result in an offline purchase, and <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/marketing-statistics?_ga=2.249309317.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">local searches lead half of all mobile users</a> to visit stores within one day.</p> \n<p>Finally, it's critical you spend time and resources on your business's website design. When these aforementioned customers find your website, they'll likely feel deterred from trusting your brand and purchasing your product if they find your site confusing or unhelpful. For this reason, it's important you take the time to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/web-design-trends-2017?_ga=2.214507541.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">create a user-friendly</a> (and mobile-friendly) website.</p> \n<h4>Internet Marketing to Cultivate Brand Loyalists</h4> \n<p>Internet marketing is for more than just attracting new customers — it's also critical for maintaining a loyal, long-term customer base. And, since it costs <a href=\"https://www.invespcro.com/blog/customer-acquisition-retention/\">five times more to attract a new customer</a> than it does to keep an existing one, this is an equally important goal.</p> \n<p>You'll want to use email, blogging, and social media tactics to increase brand awareness, cultivate a strong online community, and retain customer loyalty. Consider sending personalized emails to past customers to impress or inspire them — for instance, you might send discounts based off what they've previously purchased, wish them a happy birthday, or remind them of upcoming events.</p> \n<p>To properly employ email campaigns, you'll need an email list. Here's <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/list-building?_ga=2.214507541.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">how to build an email list from scratch</a>.</p> \n<p>Additionally, you might use social media to showcase your brand's personality and hear directly from your customers. Consider hosting a Twitter chat, posting surveys on Instagram, or creating fun contests on Facebook.</p> \n<p>If you don't feel like you have the bandwidth to create all social media content internally, consider using a third-party service like <a href=\"https://www.upcontent.com/\">UpContent</a>, which sends you compelling, curated content that you can share with your audiences for increased engagement.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>Internet Marketing vs. Content Marketing</h3> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Content marketing and internet marketing are incredibly similar strategies used to attract leads and prospects to your site, and ultimately convert web traffic into customers. However, there are a few slight differences between the two.&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Content marketing lives under the roof of online/internet marketing — which means online/internet marketing is the more broad, overarching strategy, and content marketing is one process within that strategy.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Content marketing applies <em>only</em> to the process of creating and distributing content to reach audiences.&nbsp;Online marketing, on the other hand, encompasses sharing that content through email, search engines, and social media — it also includes paid advertising, retargeting, and a wide range of strategies you might use to reach audiences online.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">While most of the strategies that fall under online marketing have to do with content creation, online marketing also pertains to the non-content creation tasks of internet marketing: such as PPC bidding, or website design.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>There are 11 strategies you'll want to employ to ensure you're successful at internet marketing.</p> \n<h3>1. Design a User-friendly Website</h3> \n<p>First, you want to create a user-friendly, and mobile-friendly, website. The design of your site will showcase your brand's personality and differentiate your business from every other online business. But it's more than just looking good — a cleaner, more well-organized site structure can affect how you rank in the SERPS.</p> \n<p>For help designing your website or ensuring it's up-to-par, check out <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/30557/6-guidelines-for-exceptional-website-design-and-usability.aspx?_ga=2.214507541.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">8 Guidelines for Exceptional Web Design, Usability, and User Experience</a>.</p> \n<h3>2. Optimize Your Site for Search Engines</h3> \n<p>Next, you'll need to keyword optimize your site for search engines. Essentially, this means you'll choose keyword(s) that relate to your business, and incorporate those keywords into the URL, body text, image text, headers, and navigation bar.</p> \n<p>For tips on keyword optimizing your entire site, check out <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/seo-site-keyword-optimize-ht?_ga=2.214507541.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">On-Page SEO 101: Tips for Keyword Optimizing the Most Critical Parts of Your Website</a>.</p> \n<p>If you're interested in focusing on keyword optimizing your blog posts, consider reading <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/blog-search-engine-optimization?_ga=2.214507541.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">Blog SEO: How to Search Engine Optimize Your Blog Content</a>.</p> \n<p>For a real-life example on how to successfully implement SEO into your digital marketing strategy, check out our case study on Canva here:</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/WuFc6UTS1T0\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<h3>3. Use Email Marketing or Opt-in Email Campaigns</h3> \n<p>Email marketing and opt-in marketing campaigns are one of the most effective long-term strategies to connect with potential customers and cultivate brand loyalty.</p> \n<p>For everything from getting started with email marketing, to email marketing best practices and lead magnets, check out <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/email-marketing-guide?_ga=2.214507541.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">The Ultimate Guide to Email Marketing</a>.</p> \n<h3>4. Write Online Press Releases</h3> \n<p>Writing online press releases is an additional way to increase online coverage of your business from other sources, which will also positively affect your ranking in the SERPs. Plus, if a local news outlet covers your business, you'll receive their audience, which you otherwise might not have reached.</p> \n<p>To get started writing a press release for your business, consider <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/press-release-template-ht?_ga=2.214507541.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">How to Write a Press Release [Free 2017 Press Release Template + Example]</a>.</p> \n<h3>5. Create a Blog</h3> \n<p>I might be biased, but blogging is one of the best ways to attract a large audience to your site, establish your business as a thought leader in your industry, and prove your brand to be both useful and current.</p> \n<p>Writing blog posts is especially effective for providing different opportunities to land on page one of search engines — for instance, maybe your eyeglass store's website is on page three of Google for “eyeglasses,” but your “Best Sunglasses of 2018” blog post is on page one, pulling in an impressive amount of traffic (over time, that blog post could also boost your overall website to page one).</p> \n<p>To learn everything from choosing a domain name to writing your first blog post, check out <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-start-a-blog?_ga=2.214507541.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">How to Start a Blog: A Step-by-Step Guide [+ Free Blog Post Templates]</a>.</p> \n<h3>6. Develop Social Media Contests and Campaigns</h3> \n<p>Social media contests and campaigns are exceptional opportunities to engage with your online audience, form relationships with customers, and learn about your buyer's persona.</p> \n<p>For an overarching compilation on everything you need to know about social media campaigns — from how to craft perfect posts on Facebook to the most shared phrases on LinkedIn — take a look at <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-campaigns?_ga=2.214507541.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">Everything You Need to Know about Social Media Campaigns.</a></p> \n<h3>7. Leverage Pay-per-click Advertising</h3> \n<p>With 45% of small businesses using paid advertising, this isn't a strategy you should ignore. Pay-per-click advertising, or PPC, is an advertising model in which advertisers only pay when someone interacts with their ad through impressions or clicks.&nbsp;</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ppc\"><span>PPC</span></a> is most commonly used on search engines, and can help your business appear for searches related to your products or services. This is particularly important for more competitive keywords, when it's difficult to rank on page one against websites with higher domain authority.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>It's important to note — PPC doesn't replace your SEO strategy, it simply complements it. For instance, if you're trying to rank for \"website builder\", you'll see the keyword difficulty is \"super hard (95)\", according to Ahrefs. However, there are some long-form keywords you might have success ranking for, including \"what is a website builder? (52)\" or \"best website builders for ecommerce (57)\".&nbsp;</p> \n<p>If you do want to target \"website builder\", you'll want to bid for an ad and use PPC to stand out against competitors.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>8. Optimize Your Site for Conversions</h3> \n<p>Okay, you got readers to your blog or homepage … now what?&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Ultimately, you'll want to invest in resources for <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/conversion-rate-optimization-guide?_ga=2.155902393.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\"><span>conversion rate optimization (CRO)</span></a>. If you don't, you risk not being able to convert any of your traffic into qualified leads and, ultimately, customers.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>There are four areas of your website that can benefit from CRO. These include the homepage, pricing page, blog, and landing pages.</p> \n<p>Within a blog, a CRO strategy might include adding relevant calls-to-action throughout the text, or inviting readers to submit their emails in exchange for an ebook. On a pricing page, a CRO strategy might include a slide-out that invites viewers to book time with a sales rep or watch a demo.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Optimizing your site for conversions is a critical component of any strong internet marketing strategy.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>9. Post Videos on YouTube or Other Social Networks</h3> \n<p>Video marketing is an undeniably powerful opportunity to reach new audiences and convert leads into customers. In fact, <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/marketing-statistics?_ga=2.214507541.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\"><span>83% of video marketers say video</span></a> has helped them generate leads, and <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/marketing-statistics?_ga=2.155902393.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\"><span>84% of people say that they've been convinced to buy a product</span></a> or service by watching a brand's video.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Convinced yet? If not, simply consider the fact that <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/state-of-video-marketing-new-data?_ga=2.155902393.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\"><span>89% of video marketers</span></a> plan to use YouTube in 2021 — which means, even if you're not posting videos on the channel, your competitors most likely are.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>You'll want to diversify the type(s) of content you produce to attract audiences who prefer video over text, or YouTube over Twitter. Consider how you might implement your own video strategy to reach and convert new audiences. If you're not sure where to start, check out HubSpot's <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/youtube-marketing?_ga=2.214507541.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\"><span>Ultimate Guide to YouTube Marketing</span></a>.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>10. Find Influencers to Work With Your Brand</h3> \n<p>I'm currently wearing a watch I found on Amazon. I'm sitting on a couch from Wayfair, with a candle from Anthropology on the table in front of me.</p> \n<p>Where did I hear about all these products? <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-work-with-influencers\"><span>Influencers</span></a>.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Social media influencers have cultivated strong, meaningful relationships with their followers. Their followers typically trust them to provide true, reliable guidance on a range of topics related to the influencers' expertise. Which is why influencer marketing can be an effective opportunity to spread brand awareness to new audiences.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>If you think influencer marketing could be a good choice for your business, consider micro-influencers as a more effective (and oftentimes more cost-efficient) option. In a recent study, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-work-with-influencers?_ga=2.155902393.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\"><span>82% of respondents</span></a> said they were \"highly likely to follow a micro-influencers' recommendation\".</p> \n<p>Additionally, it can be expensive and time-consuming to find the right influencer(s) for your brand. If you're going to invest in the strategy, consider working with the same few influencers for the long-term — which enables your company to build stronger relationships with their social followers.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>11. Create a Facebook Group</h3> \n<p>A Facebook group — unlike a Facebook page — is an exclusive, private group that enables you to facilitate a sense of community surrounding your brand.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>A <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/create-facebook-group?_ga=2.155902393.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\"><span>Facebook group</span></a> isn't a necessity for every business, but when done properly, it can go a long way towards creating a stronger relationship between you and your customers. Best of all, it can help foster connections <em>between</em> your customers.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Since having a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/agency/surprising-stats-brand-loyalty?_ga=2.155902393.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\"><span>strong community can help you build brand loyalty</span></a>, it's important to seek out unique opportunities to engage directly with your customers. If a Facebook group doesn't seem like a good fit for your business, however, there are other ways to create a sense of community — including via social media, or through a branded newsletter.</p> \n<p>Finally, take a look at our <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/essential-guide-internet-marketing?_ga=2.155902393.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">Essential Step-by-Step Guide to Internet Marketing</a> to dive deeper into the six essential steps of internet marketing.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>Online Marketing Examples</h2> \n<p>There are hundreds, if not thousands, of online marketing examples to inspire your next internet marketing campaign.</p> \n<p>Here, I'll dive into five real world examples of social media, email, SEO, and website marketing methods. I'll also include links to additional blog resources at the bottom, for even more exceptional ideas.</p> \n<h3>1. Social Media: Under Armour's \"I Will What I Want\" Campaign</h3> \n<p>Under Armour came up with the hashtag \"I Will What I Want\" to encourage powerful athletic women to achieve their dreams despite any opposition they might face. The hashtag, first used by American Ballet Theatre ballerina soloist Misty Copeland, blew up on Facebook after supermodel Gisele Bündchen used it in one of her Facebook posts. Many other female athletes have also used the hashtag.</p> \n<p>The campaign spreads a positive message of female empowerment, while also highlighting Under Armour's women apparel. The campaign reached <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/under-armours-viral-campaign-for-the-female-market-proved-a-winning-strategy/2016/07/15/73c50602-42fd-11e6-88d0-6adee48be8bc_story.html?utm_term=.040cda6489af\">five billion media impressions</a>, increased Under Armour's women's sales by <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/under-armours-viral-campaign-for-the-female-market-proved-a-winning-strategy/2016/07/15/73c50602-42fd-11e6-88d0-6adee48be8bc_story.html?utm_term=.040cda6489af\">28 percent</a>, and pulled in an additional <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/under-armours-viral-campaign-for-the-female-market-proved-a-winning-strategy/2016/07/15/73c50602-42fd-11e6-88d0-6adee48be8bc_story.html?utm_term=.040cda6489af\">42 percent of traffic</a> to their website.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/under-1.png?width=1484&amp;name=under-1.png\" alt=\"under armour's instagram campaign, an example of internet marketing\" width=\"1484\" style=\"width: 1484px;\"></p> \n<h3>2. Email: JetBlue</h3> \n<p>Companies often use email marketing to re-engage past customers, but a \"Where'd You Go? Want To Buy This?\" message can come across as aggressive, and you want to be careful with your wording to cultivate a long-term email subscriber.</p> \n<p>This is why JetBlue's one year re-engagement email works so well — it uses humor to convey a sense of friendliness and fun, while simultaneously reminding an old email subscriber they might want to check out some of JetBlue's new flight deals.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/jetblue%20email.png?width=458&amp;name=jetblue%20email.png\" alt=\"jetblue re-engagement email as an example of internet marketing\" width=\"458\" style=\"width: 458px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\">\n</div> \n<h3>3. SEO: Moz's case study for Pipedrive, a sales CRM</h3> \n<p>Using a content marketing strategy that included content creation, outreach, and guest posting, Pipedrive, a sales CRM, was able to rank #1 for a high-volume keyword — “sales management” (9,900 search volume). They were able to outrank SalesManagement.org, InsightSquared, and even US News and Wikipedia. They <a href=\"https://moz.com/blog/case-study-ranking-high-volume-keyword\">published their strategy on Moz</a>.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/moz-3.png\" alt=\"Moz's case study for pipedrive as an example of internet marketing\">\n</div> \n<h3>4. SEO: Brian Dean's YouTube strategy</h3> \n<p>Brian Dean, an SEO expert and the creator of BackLinko, uses SEO tactics to rank #1 on YouTube for keywords like “on page SEO” and “video SEO”. Initially, Dean admits his YouTube account struggled to get any views.</p> \n<p>Employing SEO methods like keyword optimization has enabled Dean to rise to #1 on YouTube for search results related to his business. He <a href=\"https://backlinko.com/how-to-rank-youtube-videos\">published his full strategy on Backlinko</a>.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/brian%20dean.png?width=1104&amp;name=brian%20dean.png\" alt=\"brian dean's video, which ranks first on YouTube for 'on page SEO', as an example of internet marketing\" width=\"1104\" style=\"width: 1104px;\">\n</div> \n<h3>5. Web Design: DisabledGO</h3> \n<p>DisabledGO, an information provider for people with disabilities in the UK and Ireland, hired Agency51 to implement an SEO migration strategy to move DisabledGO from an old platform to a new one.</p> \n<p>By applying 301 redirects to old URLS, transferring metadata, setting up Google webmaster tools, and creating a new sitemap, Agency 51 was able to successfully transfer DisabledGO to a new platform while keeping their previous SEO power alive.</p> \n<p>Additionally, they were able to boost visitor numbers by 21% year over year, and the site restructuring allowed DisabledGO to rank higher than competitors. Their <a href=\"https://www.singlegrain.com/res/digital-marketing-agency/case-studies/\">case study is available on SingleGrain.com</a>.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/disabled%20go.png?width=1162&amp;name=disabled%20go.png\" alt=\"disabled go's website restructuring, as an example of internet marketing\" width=\"1162\" style=\"width: 1162px;\">\n</div> \n<h3>More Internet Marketing Examples:</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/email-marketing-examples-list?_ga=2.189484457.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">19 of the Best Email Marketing Campaign Examples We've Ever Seen [+ Template]</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/29272/5-awesome-examples-of-engaging-social-media-campaigns.aspx?_ga=2.189484457.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">5 Real Examples of Engaging Social Media Campaign Ideas</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/b2b-content-marketing-examples?_ga=2.189484457.360317351.1623877585-1873712312.1623877585\">The Best of B2B Marketing Content: 10 Examples</a></li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"hsg-featured-snippet\"> \n <h2>Top Online Marketing Tools</h2> \n <ol> \n  <li>HubSpot</li> \n  <li>Buzzsumo</li> \n  <li>Canva</li> \n  <li>GTmetrix</li> \n  <li>Ahrefs</li> \n  <li>Buffer</li> \n  <li>Facebook Insights</li> \n  <li>SocialRank</li> \n  <li>TweetReach</li> \n  <li>Trello</li> \n  <li>Crazy Egg</li> \n  <li>Google Keywords Planner</li> \n </ol> \n</div> \n<p>Ultimately, your internet marketing strategies will work best if you incorporate inbound marketing methodology. First and foremost, you want all your online content to add value to your customers''s lives. This is the only way you'll attract quality leads and build deep relationships with your online community for the long-term.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=af934ebe-a3e6-4d2a-b12f-1c7ea40641fb&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \"
