(Clifford Chi)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/a482387e-c9f6-456b-b92f-4ba795780b19.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn41@2020_3/2021/07/12/18-35-38-384_f9874034bd791f68.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/5%20Dos%20and%20Donts%20When%20Making%20a%20SMART%20Goal%20%5BExamples%5D.png?width=624&name=5%20Dos%20and%20Donts%20When%20Making%20a%20SMART%20Goal%20%5BExamples%5D.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn49@2020_1/2021/07/12/18-35-53-710_6c96a3e65f8b37ca.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/25ef9b24-9a2a-479e-9994-c7e62e7037f7.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn28@2020_5/2021/07/12/18-35-52-124_8c2de866bf966577.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/e6052733-6314-48b7-b224-1d42c04561fe.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn25@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-52-480_e2d0212c82fab1f7.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fsmart-goal-examples&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn25@2020_1/2021/07/12/18-35-49-267_64a77ca592000c86.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938166},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"How to Calculate Standard Deviation in Excel, and Why It Matters for Marketers","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/standard-deviation-excel","description":"<p>If you’ve ever taken a statistics class, the words ‘standard deviation’ might intimidate you. This complex formula provides insightful information for datasets that averages alone cannot reveal, and thankfully, Excel makes calculating this statistic easier than putting pencil to paper.</p> \n<p>Standard deviation is frequently used by financial professionals as it can help determine risks in stock portfolios and is often applied to return on investment (ROI).</p> \n<p>For marketing professionals, standard deviation can reveal variabilities and risks in datasets that will ultimately help guide campaign decisions.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">What is standard deviation?</h2> \n<p>Simply put, standard deviation is a mathematical term that measures the variation in a set of values. In marketing, standard deviation can help account for widely varying costs or sales. If the numbers in a data set are spread far apart, they have a higher standard deviation.</p> \n<p>This measurement can help assess risk when deciding how much budget can be allocated toward certain campaigns based on the standard deviation of the ROI, just to name one example.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">How to Calculate Standard Deviation in Excel</h2> \n<p>There are six standard deviation formulas in Excel, which will be used based on whether you need to calculate sample standard deviation or population standard deviation. This is easy to identify in Excel, as the three formulas for population standard deviation include a P (.P, PA, or P at the end of STDEV).</p> \n<ol start=\"1\"> \n <li>STDEV.S</li> \n <li>STDEVA</li> \n <li>STDEV</li> \n <li>STDEV.P, STDEVPA, STDEVP</li> \n</ol> \n<h3>STDEV.S</h3> \n<p>If you are dealing with sample standard deviation and do not need to account for text or logical values, STDEV.S is the formula you will use to calculate standard deviation in Excel.</p> \n<h3>STDEVA</h3> \n<p>Alternatively, if you do need to account for text and logical values, use STDEVA, which will consider text and FALSE logical values to 0, while TRUE logical values will be read as 1.</p> \n<h3>STDEV</h3> \n<p>STDEV is simply the sample standard deviation formula that will work with older forms of Excel (2007 and before). It is the same as STDEV.S.</p> \n<h3>STDEVP, STDEVPA, STDEVP</h3> \n<p>You will almost exclusively use STDEV.S, STDEVA, or STDEV. When determining population standard deviation, you would have to include all datasets for the entirety of the population.</p> \n<p>This can actually be far more data and much less useful than examining a smaller portion of the data, or a sample, in which case you would use one of the sample standard deviation formulas.</p> \n<p>If you did, for some reason, need to determine the population standard deviation, you could still retrieve sample standard deviations and apply them to the larger dataset. The likelihood of needing these population standard deviation formulas is slim.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/stdevp-function-1f7c1c88-1bec-4422-8242-e9f7dc8bb195\">As stated by Microsoft</a>, “[STDEVP] has been replaced with one or more new functions that may provide improved accuracy and with names that better reflect their usage. Although this function is still available for backward compatibility, you should consider using the new functions from now on, because this function may not be available in future versions of Excel.”</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Sample of Standard Deviation in Excel</h2> \n<p>STDEV.S, STDEVA, or STDEV will be the most common formulas to use for marketers looking to calculate sample standard deviation in Excel.</p> \n<p>These formulas specifically calculate standard deviation for a sample of a dataset, so the result will determine the amount of variability from the average (mean) of the data.</p> \n<p>Next, we will determine how to find and use standard deviation formulas in an Excel spreadsheet.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Standard Deviation Excel Formula</h2> \n<p>As mentioned above, there are a total of six standard deviation Excel formulas, although you’ll only need one or two of them (depending on the version of Excel you use).</p> \n<p>The syntax of the standard deviation formula in Excel for STDEV.S is</p> \n<p><strong>STDEV.S(number1,[number2],...)</strong></p> \n<p><strong>Number1</strong>&nbsp;is required and refers to&nbsp;“The first number argument corresponding to a sample of a population. You can also use a single array or a reference to an array instead of arguments separated by commas,” <a href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/stdev-s-function-7d69cf97-0c1f-4acf-be27-f3e83904cc23\">as explained by Microsoft</a>.</p> \n<p><strong>Number2, …</strong>&nbsp;is optional. You can include up to 254 number arguments that refer to sample sets or data of a population, or you can use an array or reference to an array instead of number arguments.</p> \n<p>This is the STDEV.S formula used by Excel:</p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Calculate%20Standard%20Deviation%20in%20Excel,%20and%20Why%20It%20Matters%20for%20Marketers-1.png?width=115&amp;height=78&amp;name=How%20to%20Calculate%20Standard%20Deviation%20in%20Excel,%20and%20Why%20It%20Matters%20for%20Marketers-1.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"115\" height=\"78\"></p> \n<p><em>x</em>&nbsp;is the sample mean AVERAGE(number1,number2,…) and <em>n</em>&nbsp;is the sample size. Excel thankfully makes light work of applying this formula to data to calculate standard deviation.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Calculate%20Standard%20Deviation%20in%20Excel,%20and%20Why%20It%20Matters%20for%20Marketers.png?width=624&amp;height=351&amp;name=How%20to%20Calculate%20Standard%20Deviation%20in%20Excel,%20and%20Why%20It%20Matters%20for%20Marketers.png\" style=\"margin-left: 0.00px;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\" height=\"351\"></p> \n<p><em>Image via Paige Bennett</em></p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Excel Standard Deviation Function</h2> \n<p>How does one find the Excel standard deviation function that they need? In Excel, navigate to the “Formulas'' header in the topmost navigation bar. For Excel versions after 2007, the second navigation bar offers a list of popular formulas, and at the end, “More Functions.” Click “More Functions” then “Statistical” and finally scroll down to the STDEV.S or other standard deviation formula for which you need. You can then input Number1 and Number2, ….</p> \n<p>Those using an older version of Excel will not have the STDEV.S formula, but they will similarly be able to navigate to STDEV.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Why Standard Deviation is Important to Marketers</h2> \n<p>Perhaps this seems simple to some marketing professionals, or maybe this is a lot of statistical speak that sounds complex. Either way, mastering this formula and Excel function is crucial for marketers.</p> \n<p>In marketing, discussing averages for datasets is commonplace, and this can be insightful. But it can also leave out some crucial information that could impact a campaign.</p> \n<p>Standard deviation can show risks, volatility, or variability in a dataset. An average might show a promising campaign to allocate money toward, but standard deviation can show the potential risk and reward of a campaign. Together, averages and standard deviations can offer a comprehensive look at a dataset, so marketers can make the best decisions based on all of the information at hand.</p> \n<p>For example, let’s say we have two companies with different order averages.</p> \n<p>Company one has an order average of $1,000. Company two has an order average of $1,500.</p> \n<p>But Company two has a standard deviation of $500, while Company one has a standard deviation of $50. Company two has a higher order average on the surface, but a deeper dive shows that it is riskier.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Standard Deviation Can Help Marketers Assess Risk</h2> \n<p>Averages can be meaningful in showing marketers promising campaigns and to forecast their results. But what averages don’t show are the risk and variability within the data.</p> \n<p>A higher average sales number might not show a huge range of variability, and ultimately, risk. While standard deviation has long been used in finance to assess risk of stock portfolios and help professionals determine where to invest or what to expect for ROI, marketers can also benefit from using this statistical analysis in their own work.</p> \n<p>They just might find some profitable surprises and avoid risky, volatile campaigns or companies by looking at both averages and standard deviation when making decisions.</p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fstandard-deviation-excel&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 30 Jun 2021 17:07:05 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"b4e4803b87701cb5859186e62b1c03ef","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Paige Bennett","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Calculate%20Standard%20Deviation%20in%20Excel,%20and%20Why%20It%20Matters%20for%20Marketers-1.png?width=115&height=78&name=How%20to%20Calculate%20Standard%20Deviation%20in%20Excel,%20and%20Why%20It%20Matters%20for%20Marketers-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn75@2020_5/2021/07/12/18-35-49-717_db07adaf94dd872c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/How%20to%20Calculate%20Standard%20Deviation%20in%20Excel,%20and%20Why%20It%20Matters%20for%20Marketers.png?width=624&height=351&name=How%20to%20Calculate%20Standard%20Deviation%20in%20Excel,%20and%20Why%20It%20Matters%20for%20Marketers.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn76@2020_5/2021/07/12/18-35-50-743_d0c6f0625d1e4e24.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fstandard-deviation-excel&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn69@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-52-672_91829b62be373c21.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938164},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"21 of the Best Brands on Instagram Right Now","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-brands-on-instagram","description":"<p>Contrary to what your friends' photos suggest, Instagram isn't just a<a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-content-calendar\"> </a><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/social-media-content-calendar?_ga=2.167178366.1534219586.1623451039-1521708227.1623451039\">social network</a> for selfies and brunch pics. In fact, Instagram has over 200 million businesses that use its platform and 90% of users follow at least one of them, <a href=\"https://business.instagram.com/\">according to 2019 data</a>.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"New Data: Instagram Engagement Report [2021 Version]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9294dd33-9827-4b39-8fc2-b7fbece7fdb9.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p>  \n<p>In a time when<a href=\"https://www.stateofinbound.com/\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.stateofinbound.com/\">visual content remains a crucial part</a> of any brand's marketing strategy,<a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/instagram-marketing\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/instagram-marketing\">Instagram marketing</a> presents a unique opportunity to showcase your brand identity.</p> \n<p>Ready to get inspired? Check out this list of brands that are thriving on Instagram right now, and why their posts set them apart.</p> \n<h2>Best Brands on Instagram</h2> \n<p>What makes a brand great on Instagram?</p> \n<p>We polled 301 users across the United States, and asked “<em>Which of the following describes the brands you follow and enjoy on Instagram</em>?”</p> \n<p>These were their top answers:</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"What the best Instagram brands have in common\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"http://luc.id/\">Data Source</a></span></p> \n<p>While this data is from a small sample, it does highlight what we already know about Instagram audiences. They look for:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Content that relates to their lives: both personal and professional.</li> \n</ul> \n<ul> \n <li>Eye-catching, fun content.</li> \n <li>Product promotions</li> \n</ul> \n<p>What you'll see in the next section is that every brand featured meets these needs, earning them high follower counts and high engagement rates.</p> \n<p><i>Psst <em>–</em> Want to get a stunning Instagram Story auto-magically created for your brand? They stay on-trend, posting relevant content based on current events, holidays, and buzzy topics.</p> \n<p>In addition to its appreciation posts for widely loved TV characters, Strong Black Lead also promotes content the brand hosts on other platforms, such as podcasts and YouTube content.</p> \n<h3>2.<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/califiafarms/\"> </a><strong><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/califiafarms/\">Califia Farms</a></strong></h3> \n<h4><strong>Followers: 303k</strong></h4> \n<p>Warning: If you're hungry, don't head to Califia Farms' Instagram page.</p> \n<p>The brand's food photography makes it stand out among the rest, showing users how Califia Farms' products can be used to create dishes ranging from pancakes and nice cream to artichoke dip and fettuccine alfredo. <img alt=\"Califia farms instagram page\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-4.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-4.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 450px;\" title=\"\" width=\"450\"></p> \n<p>The brand doesn't shy away from featuring its product in the images either. You can usually find it somewhere in its visual content, whether it's the main subject of the photo or more in the background.</p> \n<h3>3. <strong><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/anima.iris/\">Anima Iris</a></strong></h3> \n<h4><strong>Followers: 33.4k</strong></h4> \n<p>You probably thought this list would only feature enterprise-level brands, huh?</p> \n<p>Well, there are a ton of brands that have found the magic recipe on Instagram and Anima Iris is one of them.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"Anima Iris instagram page\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-1.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-1.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 450px;\" title=\"\" width=\"450\"></p> \n<p>What sets this brand apart is the transparency of its CEO.</p> \n<p>If you watch one of Anima Iris' Instagram Stories, you'll probably see its CEO, Wilglory Tanjong, showing the behind the scenes of running a luxury purse brand, which helps its <a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/insights/data/social-media-connection/\">audience feel more connected</a>.</p> \n<p>You'll probably also see Q&amp;As, surveys, and user-generated content – all strategies that have helped the company build a strong online community and gain brand loyalists.</p> \n<h3>4.<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/lornajaneactive/\"> </a><strong><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/lornajaneactive/\">Lorna Jane</a></strong></h3> \n<h4><strong>Followers: 1M</strong></h4> \n<p><img alt=\"Lorna Jane instagram page\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-3.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-3.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 450px;\" title=\"\" width=\"450\"></p> \n<p>If your brand were a person, how would you describe its personality? Australian activewear company Lorna Jane has done an awesome job answering this<a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/34238/The-Marketer-s-Guide-to-Developing-a-Strong-Brand-Identity.aspx\"> </a><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/34238/The-Marketer-s-Guide-to-Developing-a-Strong-Brand-Identity.aspx\">important branding question</a> with its Instagram content.</p> \n<p>Spend just a few seconds scrolling through these photos, and you'll quickly be able to name the target Lorna Jane buyer: a young, sporty, twenty- or thirty-something woman who values looking good while maintaining an active lifestyle.</p> \n<p>The images posted by Lorna Jane, which often show the brand's clothing and accessories, as well as images of women who embody its target buyer persona, are colorful, playful, and inspirational, which is a perfect representation of the brand's essence.</p> \n<h3>5.<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/letterfolk/\"> </a><strong><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/letterfolk/\">Letterfolk</a></strong></h3> \n<h4><strong>Followers: 353k</strong></h4> \n<p>Letterfolk is a small business run by a couple who create and sell beautiful, handcrafted felt letterboards. Each letterboard comes with a full set of characters so people can personalize the walls of their homes, which means endless room for creativity.</p> \n<p>Instagram is the perfect platform for them to inspire customers and aspiring customers with real customers' boards, as well as ideas they've come up with and staged themselves. Their Instagram content is funny and relatable – a great recipe for shareability.</p> \n<blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background: #FFF; border: 0; border-radius: 3px; box-shadow: 0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width: 540px; min-width: 326px; padding: 0; width: calc(100% - 2px);\"> \n <div style=\"padding: 16px;\">\n  <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CP4ZGQxj7_O/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\"background: #FFFFFF; width: 224px;\">\n     &nbsp;\n    </div> \n    <div style=\"background-color: #f4f4f4; border-radius: 4px; flex-grow: 0; height: 14px; width: 144px;\">\n     &nbsp;\n    </div> \n   </div> </a> \n  <p style=\"color: #c9c8cd; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 17px; margin-bottom: 0; margin-top: 8px; overflow: hidden; padding: 8px 0 7px; text-align: center; text-overflow: ellipsis; white-space: nowrap;\"><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CP4ZGQxj7_O/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\"color: #c9c8cd; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; line-height: 17px; text-decoration: none;\">A post shared by Letterfolk (@letterfolk)</a></p> \n </div> \n</blockquote>  \n<p>Not only is this photo showing a funny and clever message, but it's also very relatable. That's why the comment section is rife with Instagram users saying things like, \"<em>No truer words have been said\"</em> and \"<em>The struggle is real.</em>\"</p> \n<h3>6.<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/apartmenttherapy/\"> </a><strong><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/apartmenttherapy/\">Apartment Therapy</a></strong></h3> \n<h4><strong>Followers: 3.1M</strong></h4> \n<p>Apartment Therapy's Instagram account really is a source of therapy, if you love the sight of cozy homes.</p> \n<p>Here are a few recent posts to Apartment Therapy's Instagram feed. <img alt=\"Apartment therapy instagram feed\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-Jun-11-2021-12-18-04-77-PM.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-Jun-11-2021-12-18-04-77-PM.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; width: 450px; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"450\"></p> \n<p>From home decor inspiration to fun challenges like their <a href=\"https://www.apartmenttherapy.com/contests/2021-small-cool\">#SmallCoolChallenge</a> contest and trendy user-generated content (UGC), this brand gives its followers plenty of inspiration to personalize their own space and \"live happy, healthy lives at home,” as written in their profile bio.</p> \n<h3>7. <strong><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/mysunday2sunday/\">Sunday II Sunday</a></strong></h3> \n<h4><strong>Followers: 20.1k</strong></h4> \n<p>Sunday II Sunday is another small business with a robust social media presence.</p> \n<p>The brand describes itself as “haircare for active women.” As such, its content revolves around having and managing an active lifestyle.</p> \n<blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background: #FFF; border: 0; border-radius: 3px; box-shadow: 0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width: 540px; min-width: 326px; padding: 0; width: calc(100% - 2px);\"> \n <div style=\"padding: 16px;\">\n  <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CP3zI_rLgOU/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\"background: #FFFFFF; width: 450px; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"450\"></p> \n<p>\"Stunning\" is the first word that comes to mind when I scroll through Tentsile's Instagram photos.</p> \n<p>Tentsile sells tree tents, what they call \"portable treehouses\" to elevate your camping experience. Its Instagram page is full of beautiful lifestyle images of their products in just about anywhere in the world: rainforests, mountains, beaches... you name it.</p> \n<p>What the brand does well is leveraging its <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/user-generated-content-stats\">UGC</a>. This saves time and resources, plus giving the brand some <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-proof-examples\">social proof.</a></p> \n<h3>9.<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/desenio/\"> </a><strong><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/desenio/\">Desenio</a></strong></h3> \n<h4><strong>Followers: 1.8M</strong></h4> \n<p><img alt=\"Desenio instagram feed\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-Jun-11-2021-12-18-04-51-PM.jpeg?width=400&amp;name=%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-Jun-11-2021-12-18-04-51-PM.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 400px;\" title=\"\" width=\"400\"></p> \n<p>The first thing you'll notice when you land on Swedish online art print company Desenio's Instagram page is color blocking.</p> \n<p>Every image blends beautifully with the one next to it, creating a cohesive, visually appealing page you never want to leave.</p> \n<p>Even when using user-generated content, the brand ensures it fits within its aesthetic. Establishing consistency in your creative assets is key in ensuring brand recognition (i.e., when people see your image anywhere, they know it's you.)</p> \n<p>However, from time to time, Desenio will stray away from its usual look, which creates even more intrigue.</p> \n<blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background: #FFF; One commenter was inspired enough to describe what winters are like where they live.</p> \n<h3>10.<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/noyourcity/\"> </a><strong><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/boldenusa/\">Bolden USA</a></strong></h3> \n<h4><strong>Followers: 32.1k</strong></h4> \n<p>Instagram is all about visuals. This means that within minutes of being on Instagram, a user can be bombarded with images.</p> \n<p>So, the question is: How do you make sure your brand stands out and is memorable?</p> \n<p>One way is by developing a unique aesthetic and remaining consistent. Bolden USA has done just that.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"Bolden USA instagram page\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-2.jpeg?width=450&amp;name=%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-2.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 450px;\" title=\"\" width=\"450\"></p> \n<p>To mirror its green logo, the theme of Bolden USA's Instagram is green. While the brand features other colors in its images, green is always the primary, standout color – an effective tactic to aid <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/brand-awareness\">brand recall and recognition</a>.</p> \n<h3>11.<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/vans/\"> </a><strong><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/vans/\">Vans</a></strong></h3> \n<h4><strong>Followers: 17.4M</strong></h4> \n<p>Vans is known for its stylish shoes and its Instagram business account is no exception.</p> \n<blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background: #FFF; While you'll still see lifestyle images with skateboarders, you'll also see surfers, cyclists, and other young, fashionable kids.</p> \n<p>So, as your brand identity and messaging evolve, your content should also follow suit.</p> \n<p>One of Vans' most interesting posts was this.</p> \n<blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background: #FFF; And for a business so dependent on style, the right amount of weird can give Vans an awesome amount of engagement.</p> \n<h3>12.<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/divinityla/\"> </a><strong><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/grass_fields/\">Grass-Fields</a></strong></h3> \n<p>Now, here's a brand that knows how to show its personality.</p> \n<p>This Cameroon-based clothing brand isn't playing it safe on Instagram with static model shots and sale promotions.</p> \n<blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background: #FFF; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 17px; margin-bottom: 0; margin-top: 8px; overflow: hidden; padding: 8px 0 7px; text-align: center; text-overflow: ellipsis; white-space: nowrap;\"><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CONpsSYDakM/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\"color: #c9c8cd; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; line-height: 17px; text-decoration: none;\">A post shared by Flodesk (@flodesk)</a></p> \n </div> \n</blockquote>  \n<p>When you land on Flodesk's page, you'll gain tips on how to use its platform as well as general tips to optimize your email marketing strategy. With the use of vibrant colors and playful designs, every post is an attention grabber.</p> \n<p>What's more, almost every post includes a call-to-action that invites the audience to engage. Whether it's to drop an emoji in the comments or answer a question – engagement done right.</p> \n<h3>20. <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/omsom/\">Omsom</a></h3> \n<h4><strong>Followers: 35k</strong></h4> \n<p>Omsom is another small business that has leveraged its CEOs, two first-generation Vietnamese sisters, to build a community on Instagram.</p> \n<blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background: #FFF; border: 0; border-radius: 3px; box-shadow: 0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width: 540px; min-width: 326px; padding: 0; width: calc(100% - 2px);\"> \n <div style=\"padding: 16px;\">\n  <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CPofKh2BgOz/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\"background: #FFFFFF; line-height: 0; padding: 0 0; text-align: center; text-decoration: none; width: 100%;\"> \n   <div style=\"display: flex; flex-direction: row; align-items: center;\"> \n    <div style=\"background-color: #f4f4f4; border-radius: 4px; flex-grow: 0; height: 14px; margin-bottom: 6px; width: 100px;\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n     <div style=\"background-color: #f4f4f4; border-radius: 4px; flex-grow: 0; height: 14px; width: 60px;\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n    </div> \n   </div> \n   <div style=\"padding: 19% 0;\">\n    &nbsp;\n   </div> \n   <div style=\"display: block; height: 50px; margin: 0 auto 12px; width: 50px;\"> \n   </div> \n   <div style=\"padding-top: 8px;\"> \n    <div style=\"color: #3897f0; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 550; line-height: 18px;\">\n     View this post on Instagram\n    </div> \n   </div> \n   <div style=\"padding: 12.5% 0;\">\n    &nbsp;\n   </div> \n   <div style=\"display: flex; flex-direction: row; margin-bottom: 14px; align-items: center;\"> \n    <div> \n     <div style=\"background-color: #f4f4f4; border-radius: 50%; height: 12.5px; width: 12.5px; transform: translateX(0px) translateY(7px);\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n     <div style=\"background-color: #f4f4f4; height: 12.5px; transform: rotate(-45deg) translateX(3px) translateY(1px); width: 12.5px; flex-grow: 0; margin-right: 14px; margin-left: 2px;\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n     <div style=\"background-color: #f4f4f4; border-radius: 50%; height: 12.5px; width: 12.5px; transform: translateX(9px) translateY(-18px);\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n    </div> \n    <div style=\"margin-left: 8px;\"> \n     <div style=\"background-color: #f4f4f4; border-radius: 50%; flex-grow: 0; height: 20px; width: 20px;\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n     <div style=\"width: 0; height: 0; border-top: 2px solid transparent; border-left: 6px solid #f4f4f4; border-bottom: 2px solid transparent; transform: translateX(16px) translateY(-4px) rotate(30deg);\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n    </div> \n    <div style=\"margin-left: auto;\"> \n     <div style=\"width: 0px; border-top: 8px solid #F4F4F4; border-right: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(16px);\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n     <div style=\"background-color: #f4f4f4; flex-grow: 0; height: 12px; width: 16px; transform: translateY(-4px);\">\n      &nbsp;\n     </div> \n     <div style=\"width: 0; flex-direction: column; flex-grow: 1; justify-content: center; margin-bottom: 24px;\"> \n    <div style=\"background-color: #f4f4f4; border-radius: 4px; flex-grow: 0; height: 14px; margin-bottom: 6px; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: 17px; margin-bottom: 0; margin-top: 8px; overflow: hidden; padding: 8px 0 7px; text-align: center; text-overflow: ellipsis; white-space: nowrap;\"><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CPofKh2BgOz/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\"color: #c9c8cd; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; line-height: 17px; text-decoration: none;\">A post shared by Omsom (@omsom)</a></p> \n </div> \n</blockquote>  \n<p>As you scroll through Omsom's Instagram, yes, you'll find beautifully crafted images showcasing the dishes you can make using the brand's food products. However, that's only one piece of the puzzle.</p> \n<p>You'll also see many posts celebrating Vietnamese culture, and debunking Asian-American stereotypes and biases.</p> \n<p>This strategy helps consumers connect with the Omsom beyond the delicious food and understand its broader mission and purpose.</p> \n<h3>21. <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/chipotle/\">Chipotle</a></h3> \n<h4><strong>Followers: 1.1M</strong></h4> \n<p>Instead of reeling in consumers with food pictures, Chipotle has chosen another route: hilarious memes.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> \n<blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background: #FFF; border: 0; border-radius: 3px; box-shadow: 0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width: 540px; min-width: 326px; padding: 0; width: calc(100% - 2px);\"> \n <div style=\"padding: 16px;\">\n  <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CPV8cEWLr2e/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\"background: #FFFFFF; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; line-height: 17px; text-decoration: none;\">A post shared by Chipotle (@chipotle)</a></p> \n </div> \n</blockquote>  \n<p>While you may find the occasional food post, the brand has focused its Instagram strategy on showing its personality.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Here's why it works: Memes are shareable and tag-friendly, which helps Chipotle reach new consumers as people tag their friends in funny, relatable posts.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>The common thread in all the brands featured is that they had a consistent brand identity that was reflected in their visuals and a deep understanding of what resonated with their audience.</p> \n<p>Ready to populate your Instagram timeline with pics and videos that are as captivating as the content above? 0Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-Jun-11-2021-12-18-05-11-PM.jpeg?width=450&name=%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-Jun-11-2021-12-18-05-11-PM.jpeg":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-Jun-11-2021-12-18-04-51-PM.jpeg?width=400&name=%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-Jun-11-2021-12-18-04-51-PM.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn91@2020_2/2021/07/12/18-35-52-768_568366cfb1af62cc.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-2.jpeg?width=450&name=%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-2.jpeg":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now.jpeg?width=400&name=%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now.jpeg":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/%5BUPDATE%5D%2021%20of%20the%20Best%20Brands%20on%20Instagram%20Right%20Now-Jun-11-2021-12-18-05-40-PM.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn4@2020_2/2021/07/12/18-35-50-185_5fd6d4681ed72999.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b1268983-9da6-4d67-9d3a-cfef2d9f3cff.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn6@2020_2/2021/07/12/18-35-49-299_a4245cc995397db3.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbest-brands-on-instagram&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn52@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-50-400_11b30cf678789b2d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938173},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"Which social media channels do consumers spend the most time on? [New Data]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-channel-time","description":"<p>Every day there’s something new on social media.</p>  \n<p>Recently, Twitter <a href=\"https://blog.twitter.com/en_us/topics/company/2021/introducing-twitter-blue.html\">introduced Twitter Blue</a>, a premium subscription-based version of its platform.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=3dc1dfd9-2cb4-4498-8c57-19dbb5671820&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Download Now: Social Media Trends in 2021 [Free Report]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3dc1dfd9-2cb4-4498-8c57-19dbb5671820.png\"></a></p> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/tiktok-for-business\">TikTok</a> took the social media world by storm back in 2020 and still remains the most downloaded app of 2021, <a href=\"https://www.socialmediatoday.com/news/tiktok-remains-the-most-downloaded-app-in-q1-2021-according-to-new-data/597672/\">according to Social Media Today</a>. Instagram is regularly adding new features to its platform, <a href=\"https://www.adweek.com/social-marketing/instagram-begins-testing-native-affiliate-tool-more-ways-for-creators-to-set-up-shops/\">recently testing a new affiliate tool for influencers</a>.</p> \n<p>The question is, how are these changes impacting how consumers behave online? Are users moving away from Facebook?</p> \n<p>Let’s see what the data says and what it means for brands.</p> \n<p>We surveyed 301 people in the United States and asked, \"<em>Which social media platform do you spend the most time on each week?</em>\" The response was kind of surprising.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/where-users-spend-most-time-on-social-media.png?width=500&amp;name=where-users-spend-most-time-on-social-media.png\" alt=\"Where users spend the most time on social media\" width=\"500\" style=\"width: 500px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Despite YouTube’s steady growth over the past year and the rise of TikTok and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/what-is-clubhouse\">Clubhouse</a>, Facebook remains the top social media platform. YouTube follows, with the gap between the platform and Facebook much smaller in larger surveys.</p> \n<p>So, what does this information really mean?</p> \n<p>Well, in a broad sense, it means you should consider having a presence on these platforms. However, don’t delete your Instagram account just yet – better yet, don’t delete it at all.</p> \n<p>I’ll explain why in the next section.</p> \n<h2>Should brands limit their efforts to the most popular platforms?</h2> \n<p>There’s no single, clear-cut answer to this... but typically, no.</p> \n<p>While most consumers may spend most of their time on Facebook and <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/youtube-marketing\">YouTube</a>, that doesn’t mean you should dedicate all your efforts entirely to those platforms.</p> \n<p>Why? That may not be where <em>your</em> audience lives.</p> \n<p>Generality is the enemy of marketing. Imagine running a social media ad that targets everyone. Or having a target audience comprising all of <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/gen-z-stats\">Gen Z</a>.</p> \n<p>This sort of one-size-fits-all isn’t conducive to your brand’s growth. In fact, it is likely keeping you from making progress, as you waste time and resources on broad strategies that may not work for your specific market.</p> \n<p>It’s like going to a party and only getting an address for the neighborhood. Sure, you could drive around and knock on every door until you find the right one, but by that point, you might be tired, hungry, and out of gas.</p> \n<p>When you zero in on a specific audience and strategy, you can gain more valuable insights and get a higher return on investment.</p> \n<p>Data, just like the one above, should be used as a general guide to understand consumer behavior. However, it shouldn’t dictate your entire strategy. Your <em>own </em>consumer data and user persona(s) should.</p> \n<p>For instance, let’s say you’ve discovered through market research that your audience enjoys consuming information mostly through blogs and podcasts. That’s a good indicator of where you should focus your efforts. In a few years, that data may change, in which case, your team should be flexible and move to where your audience is going.</p> \n<p>Here’s what you should consider when determining where to direct your efforts:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Where your audience lives</li> \n <li>The type of content you’ll be creating</li> \n <li>The channel that converts the best</li> \n</ul> \n<p>There are a few ways to figure out where your audience \"hangs out\" online. First, you can check the demographics by platform – this will give you a general idea of the audience.</p> \n<p>For instance, TikTok mostly caters to a younger audience between <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/1095186/tiktok-us-users-age/\">10 to 29 years old</a> while most Instagram users are between <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/398166/us-instagram-user-age-distribution/\">18 to 34 years old</a>.</p> \n<p>You can also reach out to your target audience directly through polls and survey to find out where they spend their time. In addition, look to your competitors.</p> \n<p>See where they’re focusing their efforts and if they are successful, that may be a good indication of where you should be. Like when you’re not sure you went to the right place but see someone you know parking and you can let out a sigh of relief.</p> \n<p>Next is the type of content you’ll be creating.</p> \n<p>Say your audience enjoys video content the most (think webinars, lives, video tutorials). In this case, your audience would be well suited for YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok, all of which have video editing and publishing features. You can then repurpose your content for each platform.</p> \n<p>Another factor to consider is how each channel is contributing to your goals. This is where the importance of data comes in.</p> \n<p>You may be posting every day on TikTok and find that the rare times you post on Facebook, you get much higher engagement and conversion rates. While there could be several reasons for this, you may want to redirect your attention to Facebook as it is providing the best return on investment.</p> \n<p>Next, we’ll cover what software can help you keep track of your social media data.</p> \n<h2>Top Social Media Analytics Software</h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/social-inbox\">HubSpot</a></h3> \n<p>With HubSpot’s social media management software, you can track your social strategy from beginning to end.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"HubSpot social media software\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png?width=500&amp;name=Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 500px;\" title=\"\" width=\"500\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/social-inbox\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>With a user-friendly dashboard, you can see exactly how your published posts are performing, which channels are bringing traffic to your website and generating leads, and more.</p> \n<p>You can also filter your reports by campaign, account, and date range so you can narrow down the exact information you’re looking for.</p> \n<p>In addition, HubSpot’s social media software allows you to:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Schedule posts.</li> \n <li>See how your competitors measure up.</li> \n <li>Track and monitor conversations surrounding your brand on every platform.</li> \n <li>Export and analyze relevant reports.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>The social media tool is available within HubSpot’s all-in-one CRM platform for mid- to large-size businesses.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://hootsuite.com/\">HootSuite</a></h3> \n<p>HootSuite empowers your team to make decisions quickly with real-time data on your social strategy.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"Hootsuite social media software\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.jpeg?width=500&amp;name=Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; width: 500px;\" title=\"\" width=\"500\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://www.hootsuite.com/platform/monitor\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>The social media software takes some of the guesswork out so that you can focus on the most important insights. With customizable dashboards, you can also get a quick overview of your key metrics and identify what’s driving traffic and sales.</p> \n<p>Ranging from $49/month to custom pricing for enterprise-level businesses, you can find a plan that meets your needs and is scalable.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/\">Sprout Social</a></h3> \n<p>If you have multiple social channels running at full speed and you’re overwhelmed with the data, Sprout Social can help.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"Sprout Social social media software\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D-1.jpeg?width=500&amp;name=Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D-1.jpeg\" style=\"margin-left: auto; width: 500px; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"500\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 12px;\"><a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/features/social-media-analytics/\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>The platform helps you manage your data and create ready-to-go reports to share with stakeholders.</p> \n<p>In addition, you can use competitive intelligence to benchmark your performance and make informed decisions that will promote your brand’s growth.</p> \n<p>Sprout Social’s pricing is based on a subscription model and ranges from $99 to $249 a month.</p> \n<p>Now that you know where consumers spend their time online, the real work begins. Experiment with various strategies to see what resonates best with your audience, always using data and your user personas to inform your decisions.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=5fc2491c-cd3c-4adb-ad3c-b082ce2793d3&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New call-to-action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5fc2491c-cd3c-4adb-ad3c-b082ce2793d3.png\"></a></p>  \n<img +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3dc1dfd9-2cb4-4498-8c57-19dbb5671820.png","linkMd5":"746d2b167fddfc25cb7c5fc48a7a5645","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn22@2020_6/2021/07/12/18-35-38-374_ebc276d76ef14084.webp","destWidth":517,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":6135,"destBytes":8328,"author":"mbretous@hubspot.com (Martina Bretous)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3dc1dfd9-2cb4-4498-8c57-19dbb5671820.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn22@2020_6/2021/07/12/18-35-38-374_ebc276d76ef14084.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/where-users-spend-most-time-on-social-media.png?width=500&name=where-users-spend-most-time-on-social-media.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn45@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-53-055_427928262d598d20.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png?width=500&name=Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn73@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-51-190_adb85b484d02c625.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.jpeg?width=500&name=Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn30@2020_6/2021/07/12/18-35-53-393_df42a82a1d7d38db.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D-1.jpeg?width=500&name=Where%20Consumers%20Spend%20the%20Most%20Time%20Online%20%26%20What%20That%20Means%20for%20You%20%5BNew%20Data%5D-1.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn9@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-48-796_1e91e3154ee94426.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/5fc2491c-cd3c-4adb-ad3c-b082ce2793d3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn52@2020_1/2021/07/12/18-35-51-882_73ab6e288063122a.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fsocial-media-channel-time&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn28@2020_6/2021/07/12/18-35-49-589_fcd3e7936ea22cc7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938154},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"6 Ways to Use Google Trends for Marketing","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/google-trends","description":"<p>What did you last Google? Willing to share it with the public?</p> \n<p>Search histories can tell a story about a person and what they're thinking.</p> \n<p>But I can't imagine anyone would willingly give up their personal search history — especially if it identifies them — without some sort of incentive.</p> \n<p>Thankfully, we can tap into Google Trends for these insights.</p> \n<p>Let's dive into what Google Trends is, where the data comes from, and how you can use Google Trends for market research, product innovation, and more.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=1d7211ac-7b1b-4405-b940-54b8acedb26e&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Download Now: SEO Starter Pack [Free Kit]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/1d7211ac-7b1b-4405-b940-54b8acedb26e.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">What is Google Trends?</h2> \n<p>\"Explore what the world is searching\" greets you on the <a href=\"https://trends.google.com/trends/\">Google Trends homepage</a>&nbsp;and accurately reflects what the tool does.</p> \n<p>Google Trends visualizes trending topics, search terms, and news on Google. It provides real-time data regarding <em>current</em>&nbsp;trends from the past seven days, as well as <em>past</em>&nbsp;trends, which dates back to 2004.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Where Does Google Trends Data Come From</h2> \n<p>Google Trends includes anonymized samples — real-time and non-real-time — of search requests made to Google, which is then categorized into topics.</p> \n<p>Because we can see trends by location, <a href=\"https://support.google.com/trends/answer/4365533?hl=en&amp;ref_topic=6248052#:~:text=How%20is%20Google%20Trends%20data%20normalized\">the data is normalized</a>&nbsp;to ensure regions with the most search volume do not consistently rank the highest.</p> \n<p>To normalize the data, Google divides each data point by the total searches of the geography and time range it represents to compare relative popularity. Those numbers are then scaled on a range of 0 to 100, based on a topic's proportion to all searches on all topics.</p> \n<p>One major caveat to the data is that Google retains queries that may come from \"irregular activity.\" <a href=\"https://support.google.com/trends/answer/4365533?hl=en&amp;ref_topic=6248052#:~:text=What%20searches%20are%20included%20in%20Google%20Trends\">Google says</a>&nbsp;this is done to preserve the quality of the search data provided from other Google tools.</p> \n<p>Simply put, if Google filtered out the spammy activity from Trends, spammers could then use the tool to understand which words are identified as spam, and adjust accordingly.</p> \n<p>In addition to the search query data, <a href=\"https://trends.google.com/trends/trendingsearches/realtime?geo=US&amp;category=all\">the Realtime Search Trends report</a>&nbsp;also includes the number of Google News articles written per hour.</p> \n<h2 style=\"font-weight: normal;\">How to Use Google Trends</h2> \n<p>Google Trends has several ways to slice and dice the data. Google Trends has four main sections:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Explore</li> \n <li>Trending Searches</li> \n <li>Year in Search</li> \n <li>Subscriptions</li> \n</ul> \n<p>The data can be filtered by location, date, categories, search section (i.e., News vs. Shopping), and even by topics vs. search terms. Rather than walking through each section and visualization, let's see how they can apply to common marketing tasks.</p> \n<h3>1. Use Google Trends for Market Research</h3> \n<p>Need to understand the interest in your product or service to launch in a new market?</p> \n<p>Google Trends Explore can help you understand how seasonality and location might affect your product or service.</p> \n<p>In the Country drop-down selector below your query, for instance, you can filter down to a metropolitan area or click into the options on the map. You can also change the date to expand or decrease the history — but keep in mind the sample will change if you select a time within seven days.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/market-research-section-min.png?width=771&amp;name=market-research-section-min.png\" alt=\"market-research-section-min\" width=\"771\" style=\"width: 771px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>Pro Tip: </strong>As you are typing in your query, notice the auto-populated options. Anything that does</p> \n<p>not have a \"search term\" underneath it is a Topic. Topics are aggregated categories, while search terms focus on keywords. The same applies to the \"Related topics\" and \"Related queries\" tables. Start broader with a topic, and then narrow down to specific search terms as you analyze the results.</p> \n<h3>2. Test Out Google Trends for Newsjacking</h3> \n<p>Do you use <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/newsjacking-examples\">newsjacking</a>&nbsp;to help generate content? Then you should definitely use <a href=\"https://trends.google.com/trends/subscriptions\">Google Trends subscriptions</a>. Sign up to get the top, most, or all search trends weekly, daily, or as they happen.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/email-alert-min.png?width=648&amp;name=email-alert-min.png\" alt=\"email-alert-min\" width=\"648\" style=\"width: 648px;\"></p> \n<h3>3. Leverage Google Trends for Keyword Research</h3> \n<p>Many keyword research tools show an expected monthly search volume. Unless you've been tracking that data month-by-month, it's hard to tell if searches for the topic are trending up or down. Google Trends can give you the directional data to pair with your monthly search volume.</p> \n<p>While you are checking trends for your keywords, you can find related queries that are on the rise to also consider in your keyword set.</p> \n<p>If you aren't sure what people might be searching for, use the topic presented by Google in auto-complete, where possible, and check&nbsp;<a href=\"https://support.google.com/trends/answer/4355000\">the \"Related queries</a>\"&nbsp;filtered by Top queries. Once you've found different terms in the related queries, add, up to five, to compare them.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/compare-min.png?width=1053&amp;name=compare-min.png\" alt=\"compare-min\" width=\"1053\" style=\"width: 1053px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>Pro Tip:</strong>&nbsp;Make sure you are using search terms. Wrapping your search in quotations ensures the whole phrase is used in that order. You can further <a href=\"https://support.google.com/trends/answer/4359582?hl=en&amp;ref_topic=4365530\">refine your search with punctuation</a>&nbsp;to include or exclude certain words.</p> \n<h3>4. Use Google Trends for Product Innovation</h3> \n<p>Are you looking for insights into the latest colors, materials, or styles for your product? Suppose you start broadly with a topic in Explore.</p> \n<p>In that case, the \"Related queries\" filtered by Rising can surface trending colors, materials, or other product innovations and indicate how much the interest has increased in the selected time frame. Those marked with Breakout show a significant increase from the previous period, growing more than 5000%.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/rising-related-queries-min.png?width=1161&amp;name=rising-related-queries-min.png\" alt=\"rising-related-queries-min\" width=\"1161\" style=\"width: 1161px;\"></p> \n<h3>5. Employ Google Trends for Topic Clustering</h3> \n<p>Hopefully, you understand the difference between search terms and topics in Trends by now.</p> \n<p>With topics, Google Trends can help simplify your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/customers/ignite-organic-growth-topic-cluster-strategy-hubspot?_ga=2.173600736.294127761.1622180794-1790977579.1622180794\">topic cluster strategy</a>. As you search for a term, Google will provide you with topics instead of just search terms, and once one is selected, lists \"Related topics\", too. You can get a sense for how Google News helps build relationships between topics by checking out the real-time search trends report.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/realtimetrends-min.png?width=952&amp;name=realtimetrends-min.png\" alt=\"realtimetrends-min\" width=\"952\" style=\"width: 952px;\"></p> \n<p>We can go even broader than topics, though. Once you've selected a term, you can then choose a Category. While these are meant to refine your search query, you can remove your search after a Category has been selected and be left with queries and topics tied to the high-level category.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/category-explore-min.png?width=943&amp;name=category-explore-min.png\" alt=\"category-explore-min\" width=\"943\" style=\"width: 943px;\"></p> \n<h3>6. Test Out Google Trends for Analyzing News Publications</h3> \n<p>Are you pitching to or working in the news? Then you want to dig into the <a href=\"https://trends.google.com/trends/trendingsearches/\">Trending Searches data</a>.</p> \n<p>As mentioned before, the real-time trending searches lists how many Google News articles have been created about a trending topic each hour. Once you select a topic, the bar charts show the newly-added articles that hour and the cumulative total. You can see how the news may lead or follow the search trend.</p> \n<p>The articles listed are the top articles based on the Google News' ranking system, <a href=\"https://support.google.com/trends/answer/6248105?hl=en&amp;ref_topic=6248052#zippy=%2Chow-are-the-related-news-articles-selected-under-daily-and-realtime-searches\">per Google</a>. If you subscribe to specific topics, you can monitor which publications rank well.</p> \n<p>Focus on pitching those publications that are regularly featured on your topics. If you are a publisher, audit those competitors to see if you can update your structured data or Publisher Center information to get on their level.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/news-articles-barchart-min.png?width=1158&amp;name=news-articles-barchart-min.png\" alt=\"news-articles-barchart-min\" width=\"1158\" style=\"width: 1158px;\"></p> \n<p>Ready to start exploring? Dive into Google Trends now, and see the unique ways you can leverage the tool for your own business needs.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=8835eaa3-be7b-4697-81d2-488e03708d34&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"SEO Starter Pack\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8835eaa3-be7b-4697-81d2-488e03708d34.png\"></a></p>  \n<img
