Riserbato","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/814dd420-0d49-40e0-b59c-f01066e186c1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn7@2020_1/2021/07/12/18-35-38-385_eac7fa40866dc905.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20is%20Brand%20Salience%3F%20%5B+How%20Do%20You%20Measure%20It%3F%5D.png?width=624&name=What%20is%20Brand%20Salience%3F%20%5B+How%20Do%20You%20Measure%20It%3F%5D.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn29@2020_2/2021/07/12/18-35-52-784_32073ff82fc8dd87.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/ddbf2eb7-04e8-44b2-9e05-b21264e09b65.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn76@2020_3/2021/07/12/18-35-49-519_f4156d3bc1379fd0.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbrand-salience&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn79@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-50-158_98489784c814b156.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938133},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"8 Best Video Hosting Sites for Businesses in 2021","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/video-platforms","description":"<p>In middle school, my best friend and I used to have a show on YouTube where we performed a dare from our audience each week.</p> \n<p>We actually had some fans that would watch our videos and dare us to do something on a weekly basis.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>While hosting these types of videos on YouTube made sense because they were for entertainment purposes, your business needs a platform with more features so you can create videos for marketing campaigns, sales pitches, and customer service knowledge base articles.</p> \n<p>In this post, let's review some of the best video hosting sites for your business.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=8f27c677-d952-4663-8787-bf65c6a1ecf2&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"→ Access Now: Video Marketing Starter Pack [Free Kit]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8f27c677-d952-4663-8787-bf65c6a1ecf2.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p></p> \n<h3>Video Platforms</h3> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/video-hosting\">HubSpot</a></h4> \n<p>If you're a HubSpot customer, you might already have access to HubSpot's video hosting, creation, and management tool.</p> \n<p>With this tool, you can host and manage video files inside the HubSpot platform and then embed those videos on your website pages, blog posts, social media channels, or knowledge base.</p> \n<p>Using the same platform that you use for your marketing, sales, or service tool is a great idea because everything is all in one place. You can optimize your videos for SEO right in the tool.</p> \n<p>This video hosting product also allows you to insert CTAs and forms into videos, trigger video workflows that provide targeted content to leads, and video analytics so you know which videos resonate with your audience.</p> \n<p>For sales reps, you can use the video hosting tool to send video voicemails or record your screen during a sales call. You can also see if a prospect has watched the video in HubSpot's tool.</p> \n<p>Video can also be used for customer service. You can send video tutorials and record your screen right from a ticket to share it with customers for personalized and quick support. Or you can insert these videos into your knowledge base articles or FAQ page.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.twentythree.com/\">Twenty Three</a></h4> \n<p>Twenty Three is another great video hosting service for your business. You can host and embed videos on your site with Twenty Three's 4K HD player. You can also directly clip and duplicate videos in the editor.</p> \n<p>The best feature of this site is that you can publish and measure your videos across multiple platforms, including Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and YouTube.</p> \n<p>Additionally, this hosting site connects with other tools you might be using for marketing software, including HubSpot or Marketo.</p> \n<p>Plus, you can use analytics to better understand your marketing data.</p> \n<p>Using video for your business can help engage your audience, create a branded experience, and drive results.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.cincopa.com/\">Cincopa</a></h4> \n<p>Cincopa is a video and podcast hosting platform for businesses. With this platform, you can create videos for marketing campaigns, sales prospects, or customer support. Additionally, this platform can host podcasts and images as well.</p> \n<p>With this hosting site, you can also combine your media gallery to create a video course with images, video, or podcast files. I don't know about you, but I've seen online courses become all the rage in recent years, so this is a great feature to consider.</p> \n<p>You can embed these videos on your site, social media, email, and more.</p> \n<h4>4. <a href=\"https://www.hippovideo.io/\">Hippo Video</a></h4> \n<p>Hippo Video is a video hosting platform that you can use to personalize your video emails for messages, demos, sales pitches, marketing campaigns, and more.</p> \n<p>Using videos in the sales cycle can actually get three times more prospect engagement.</p> \n<p>With this tool, you can record and send videos right in your email inbox. Additionally, you can integrate this tool with your current stack, including with Slack, HubSpot, Salesforce, Zoom, Zendesk, and more.</p> \n<h4>5. <a href=\"https://sproutvideo.com/\">SproutVideo</a></h4> \n<p>SproutVideo is a great option for a video hosting platform if you're looking for a no-frills, affordable platform.</p> \n<p>With this tool, you can create videos and collaborate with your team. You can share a secure internal video, or live stream a product launch. Whatever your video needs are, this is an excellent option to consider.</p> \n<h3>Free Video Hosting Sites</h3> \n<h4>6. <a href=\"https://vimeo.com/\">Vimeo</a></h4> \n<p>Vimeo is one of the most popular video hosting sites and for good reason. This simple tool can be used to create, manage, and share high-quality videos.</p> \n<p>To create videos, you can use templates, license stock footage, record video messages, or live stream. When you're editing your videos, you might be able to integrate Vimeo with your editor. Vimeo integrates with Adobe Premiere, Final Cut Pro, and others. Then, your videos will be hosted in one central, secure location so you can seamlessly share them with anyone.</p> \n<p>You can even create a subscription streaming service for your videos on this platform.</p> \n<p>The best part? Vimeo is free. You can upgrade to paid plans, but you'll never have to pay for Vimeo if you don't want or need to.</p> \n<h4>7. <a href=\"https://www.vidyard.com/\">Vidyard</a></h4> \n<p>Vidyard is one of the only video hosting sites that is built directly with sales in mind. The idea is to build a great sales process to make remote selling easy, from prospecting to proposals, you can record and send videos that add a personal touch at all stages of the sales cycle.</p> \n<p>With Vidyard, you can create your videos in just a few clicks, with no video expertise required (that's great for tech-challenged people like me).</p> \n<p>This tool is also free. You don't ever have to pay unless you want to upgrade to a different plan with more features.</p> \n<p>My favorite feature of this tool is that you can easily create videos, track who watches them, and distribute them an unlimited number of times (yes, even in the free version).</p> \n<h4>8. <a href=\"https://wistia.com/\">Wistia</a></h4> \n<p>Another great video hosting site is Wistia. You can host videos and even podcasts on this hosting platform for marketers.</p> \n<p>On Wistia, you can upload, customize, and embed branded videos or podcasts on one platform. This also has a free plan that you can use, as long as you don't need to create too many videos a month (three is the max on the free plan). However, if you need more, there are paid plans as well.</p> \n<p>But my favorite feature of this tool is that it can integrate with your tech stack and send engagement data to your CRM, ad platforms, and marketing tools.</p> \n<p>Video is only continuing to grow, as people spend more time watching video than reading text. As your business continues to evolve, it's important to have a video hosting tool that can grow with you and help you use videos to drive results for all aspects of your business.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=24602c1f-158a-4419-b428-0ddc9092f2b0&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Discover videos, templates, tips, and other resources dedicated to helping you  launch an effective video marketing strategy.&nbsp;\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/24602c1f-158a-4419-b428-0ddc9092f2b0.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fvideo-platforms&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 05 Jul 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8f27c677-d952-4663-8787-bf65c6a1ecf2.png","linkMd5":"67412e945c19692a78245e521af25367","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn33@2020_6/2021/07/12/18-35-38-360_4f4e7f5d5c2f53ad.webp","destWidth":448,"destHeight":59,"sourceBytes":5399,"destBytes":7402,"author":"Rebecca Riserbato","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/8f27c677-d952-4663-8787-bf65c6a1ecf2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn33@2020_6/2021/07/12/18-35-38-360_4f4e7f5d5c2f53ad.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/24602c1f-158a-4419-b428-0ddc9092f2b0.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn25@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-49-838_1606a7f1b4009c0e.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fvideo-platforms&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn89@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-49-038_aa0ee6c6fda8c2e2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938120},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"Variable Cost Explained in 200 Words (& How to Calculate It)","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/variable-cost","description":"<p>There’s a frustrating truth that every business deals with early into its growth: More money, more problems.</p> \n<p>It seems counterintuitive — if sales and revenue are up, isn’t that a good thing? How are bigger profits a potential problem?</p> \n<p>Put simply, it all comes down to the fact that the more you sell, the more money you need to spend. This includes marketing and sales campaigns to reach more customers, the production costs of more goods, and the time and money required for new product development.</p> \n<p>Known as variable cost, this sales/spend ratio is something every business owner should understand, but online advice listicles and action plans often assume readers have an intrinsic knowledge of this concept rather than providing a working definition.</p> \n<p>In this piece, we’ll clear up variable cost confusion: Here’s what you need to know about variable costs, how to calculate them, and why they matter.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=3e2abb94-93d9-4cf5-bd8e-6a96ecc14270&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Click here to download 8 free marketing budget templates.\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3e2abb94-93d9-4cf5-bd8e-6a96ecc14270.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Let’s examine each of these components in more detail.</p> \n<h3>Variable Cost Per Unit</h3> \n<p>The variable cost per unit is the amount of labor, materials, and other resources required to produce your product. For example, if your company sells sets of kitchen knives for $300 but each set requires $200 to create, test, package, and market, your variable cost per unit is $200.</p> \n<h3>Number of Units Produced</h3> \n<p>The number of units produced is exactly what you might expect — it’s the total number of items produced by your company. So in our knife example above,if you’ve made and sold 100 knife sets your total number of units produced is 100, each of which carries a $200 variable cost and a $100 potential profit.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Variable costs earn the name because they can increase and decrease as you make more or less of your product. The more units you sell, the more money you’ll make, but some of this money will need to pay for the production of more units. So, you’ll need to produce <em>more</em> units to actually turn a profit.</p> \n<img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/image-png-Jun-14-2021-02-37-23-12-PM.png\" alt=\"Variable Cost Formula\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; font-size: 18px; font-family: AvenirNext, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;\"> \n<p>And, because each unit requires a certain amount of resources, a higher number of units will raise the variable costs needed to produce them.</p> \n<p>Variable costs aren’t a “problem,” though — they’re more of a necessary evil. They play a role in several bookkeeping tasks, and both your <em>total</em> variable cost and <em>average</em> variable cost are calculated separately.</p> \n<h3>Total Variable Cost</h3> \n<p>Your total variable cost is the sum of all variable costs associated with each individual product you’ve developed. Calculate total variable cost by multiplying the cost to make one unit of your product by the number of products you’ve developed.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/image-png-Jun-14-2021-01-56-19-58-PM.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" alt=\"Total Variable Cost\"></p> \n<p>For example, if it costs $60 to make one unit of your product and you’ve made 20 units, your total variable cost is $60 x 20, or $1,200.</p> \n<h3>Average Variable Cost</h3> \n<p>Your average variable cost uses your total variable cost to determine how much, on average, it costs to produce one unit of your product. You can calculate it with the formula below.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/average%20variable%20cost.png?width=690&amp;height=222&amp;name=average%20variable%20cost.png\" alt=\"Formula for average variable cost\" width=\"690\" height=\"222\" style=\"width: 690px;\"></p> \n<h3>Total Variable Cost vs. Average Variable Cost</h3> \n<p>If the average variable cost of one unit is found using your total variable cost, don’t you already know how much one unit of your product costs to develop? Can’t you work backward, and simply divide your total variable cost by the number of units you have? Not necessarily.</p> \n<p>While total variable cost shows how much you’re paying to develop every unit of your product, you might also have to account for products that have different variable costs per unit. That’s where average variable cost comes in.</p> \n<p>For example, if you have 10 units of Product A at a variable cost of $60/unit, and 15 units of Product B at a variable cost of $30/unit, you have two different variable costs — $60 and $30. Your average variable cost crunches these two variable costs down to one manageable figure.</p> \n<p>In the above example, you can find your average variable cost by adding the total variable cost of Product A ($60 x 10 units, or $600) and the total variable cost of Product B ($30 x 15 units, or $450), then dividing this sum by the total number of units produced (10 + 15, or 25).</p> \n<p>Your average variable cost is ($600 + $450) ÷ 25, or <strong>$42 per unit.</strong></p> \n<h2><strong>Variable vs. Fixed Cost</strong></h2> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">The opposite of variable cost? Fixed cost. <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/fixed-cost?_ga=2.4707386.887401265.1623678100-516008119.1623678100\"><span>Fixed costs</span></a> are costs that don’t change in response to the number of products you’re producing.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Some common fixed costs include renting or leasing a building, utility bills, website hosting, business loan repayments, and property taxes.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Worth noting? These costs aren’t <em>static </em>— meaning, your rent may increase year over year. Instead, they remain fixed only in reference to product production.</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">To calculate the average fixed cost, use this formula:</p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\"><img src=\"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/1gkbyHvmGO0nskCHjYp6ytLfyTG_0dntkxdI3eiOeuJ1FbAiBF0sTwmaDXwCG22nayFmpC7AV2zAmGmb_vCBFcN6WNx2MaA576Sd3tIT3g5WB9OvLCjfuzp4FPa3PL_wjrlAUCYk\" width=\"624\" height=\"203\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" alt=\"Average Fixed Cost formula\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Both variable and fixed costs are essential to getting a complete picture of how much it costs to produce an item — and how much profit remains after each sale.</p> \n<p>To calculate variable cost ratio, use this formula:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image-png-Jun-14-2021-02-06-12-71-PM.png?width=451&amp;name=image-png-Jun-14-2021-02-06-12-71-PM.png\" width=\"451\" style=\"width: 451px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" alt=\"Variable Cost Ratio Formula\"></p> \n<p>Let’s put it into practice. If you’re selling an item for $200 (Net Sales) but it costs $20 to produce (Variable Costs), you divide $20 by $200 to get 0.1. Multiply by 100 and your variable cost ratio is 10%. This means that for every sale of an item you’re getting a 90% return with 10% going toward variable costs.</p> \n<p>Combining variable and fixed costs, meanwhile, can help you calculate your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/break-even-point\"><span>break-even point </span></a>— the point at which producing and selling goods is zeroed out by the combination of variable and fixed costs.</p> \n<p>Consider our example above again. If your variable costs are $20 on a $200 item and your fixed costs account for $100, your total costs now account for 60% of the item’s sale value, leaving you with 40%.</p> \n<p>Put simply? The higher your total cost ratio, the lower your potential profit. If this number becomes negative, you’ve passed the break-even point and will start losing money on every sale.</p> \n<p>So, what’s considered a variable cost to the business?</p> \n<p>Some of the most common variable costs include physical materials, production equipment, sales commissions, staff wages, credit card fees, online payment partners, and packaging/shipping costs.</p> \n<p>Let’s examine each in more detail.</p> \n<h3><strong>Physical Materials</strong></h3> \n<p>These can include parts, cloth, and even food ingredients required to make your final product.</p> \n<h3><strong>Production Equipment</strong></h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">If you automate certain parts of your product’s development, you might need to invest in more automation equipment or software as your product line gets bigger.</span></p> \n<h3><strong>Sales Commissions</strong></h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">The more products your company sells, the more you might pay in commission to your salespeople as they win customers.</span></p> \n<h3><strong>Staff Wages</strong></h3> \n<p>The more products you create, the more employees you might need, which means a bigger payroll, too.</p> \n<h3><strong>Credit Card Fees</strong></h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">Businesses that receive credit card payments from their customers will incur higher transaction fees as they deliver more services.</span></p> \n<h3><strong>Online Payment Partners</strong></h3> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">Apps like PayPal typically charge businesses per transaction so customers can check out purchases through the app. The more orders you receive, the more you'll pay to the app.</span></p> \n<h3><strong>Packaging and Shipping Costs</strong></h3> \n<p>You might pay to package and ship your product by the unit, and therefore more or fewer shipped units will cause these costs to vary.</p> \n<h2><strong>Expect the Unexpected</strong></h2> \n<p>While variable costs, total variable costs, average variable costs, and the variable cost ratio often seem complicated on the surface, these terms are simply ways to represent the changing nature of costs to produce new items as your business grows.</p> \n<p>By understanding the nature of these costs and how they impact your current and projected revenue, it’s possible to better prepare for evolving market forces and reduce the impact of variable costs on your bottom line.<a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=9ce704de-19f2-4fd0-8041-22dc3c021b87&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Business Plan Template\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9ce704de-19f2-4fd0-8041-22dc3c021b87.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fvariable-cost&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 24 Jun 2021 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3e2abb94-93d9-4cf5-bd8e-6a96ecc14270.png","linkMd5":"fd4d2dfb4264b00094a77ca5113b36be","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn28@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-47-759_ccb05f23cfee781e.webp","destWidth":526,"destHeight":60,"sourceBytes":5240,"destBytes":8172,"author":"brbecker@hubspot.com (Braden Becker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/3e2abb94-93d9-4cf5-bd8e-6a96ecc14270.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn28@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-47-759_ccb05f23cfee781e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/image-png-Jun-14-2021-02-37-23-12-PM.png":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/image-png-Jun-14-2021-01-56-19-58-PM.png":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/average%20variable%20cost.png?width=690&height=222&name=average%20variable%20cost.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn11@2020_3/2021/07/12/18-35-52-058_aac931887b68eedc.webp","https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/1gkbyHvmGO0nskCHjYp6ytLfyTG_0dntkxdI3eiOeuJ1FbAiBF0sTwmaDXwCG22nayFmpC7AV2zAmGmb_vCBFcN6WNx2MaA576Sd3tIT3g5WB9OvLCjfuzp4FPa3PL_wjrlAUCYk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn71@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-48-742_e403bb277e154214.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image-png-Jun-14-2021-02-06-12-71-PM.png?width=451&name=image-png-Jun-14-2021-02-06-12-71-PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn11@2020_1/2021/07/12/18-35-50-110_e9c6dbd135be0980.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9ce704de-19f2-4fd0-8041-22dc3c021b87.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn6@2020_5/2021/07/12/18-35-49-509_ec9e2c896a128892.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fvariable-cost&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn61@2020_2/2021/07/12/18-35-48-851_edbb92c14ac3dadb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938148},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"5 Successful Email Marketing Strategies for Black-Owned Businesses [+ Examples]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/email-marketing-black-owned-businesses","description":"<p><em>Welcome to<span>&nbsp;</span></em><strong><em>Breaking the Blueprint</em></strong><em><span>&nbsp;</span>— a new blog series that dives into the unique business challenges and opportunities of Black business owners and entrepreneurs. Learn how they’ve grown or scaled their businesses, explored entrepreneurial ventures within their companies, or created side hustles, and how their stories can inspire and inform your own success.</em></p> \n<p>We live in a digital era, and people are still checking their emails daily, so strong email marketing strategies are essential, especially for Black-owned businesses.</p> \n<p>When thinking about creating the best email marketing strategies, make sure you are authentic and tell your community your story.</p> \n<p>Do a brain dump of your ideas if you need to find purpose and discover the expected outcome for each marketing strategy you are working to create.</p> \n<blockquote> \n <p><span style=\"font-weight: normal;\">The Black community supports you best when you're honest, so they can empathize with you. </span></p> \n</blockquote> \n<p>\"The most effective email marketing campaigns we've launched have been those that are authentic, tell our story, and bring our audience along for the ride. In the early days before we launched our company, all we had was our story to draw people into our funnel,\" <a href=\"https://themostcurls.co/\">THE MOST</a>&nbsp;founder and CEO Dawn Myers told HubSpot.</p> \n<p>Myers adds, \"Be vulnerable. Show the ups and downs of entrepreneurship. Show that you identify with their pain points and how much you've sacrificed to be able to serve them. This tactic builds deep credibility and trust.\"</p> \n<p>Below, you can find five email strategies that have worked for Black business owners today.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Dawn%20quote.png?width=1600&amp;name=Dawn%20quote.png\" alt=\"Email marketing strategy from Dawn Myers CEO of THE MOST\" width=\"1600\" style=\"width: 1600px;\"></p> \n<p>Additionally, for additional email marketing resources, check out these blogs on <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-plan-template-generator\">how to create an outstanding marketing plan</a>&nbsp;and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/email-marketing-2017\">how to craft successful email marketing plans</a>, with downloadable templates included.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=6cbfefbe-be32-4e0c-9576-d4b6a56dc541&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Learn More About HubSpot's Community to Amplify Black Professionals\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6cbfefbe-be32-4e0c-9576-d4b6a56dc541.png\"></a></p> \n<h2><strong>Successful Email Marketing Strategies for Black-Owned Businesses</strong></h2> \n<h3>1. Find out what else your audience cares about in correlation with your mission.</h3> \n<p>If someone subscribes to your email list, it's safe to say they have already heard of your product or find it interesting, so it's important to dig deeper beyond that.</p> \n<p>Ariel Butler, founder and CEO of hair and skin products company <a href=\"https://sheaade.com/\">Shea Adé</a>, learned that people mainly care about when the company is emailing about sales when it comes to product-based businesses. It can also get daunting if emails are about the same products consumers have already heard about.</p> \n<p>\"I'd recommend brands find other topics to email their audience about (blog posts, free ebooks, etc.),\" she said. \"Everything outside of that should be emails about sales or new product releases as opposed to the emails that look like <em>'Hey, don't forget to buy this full-priced item that I've been bugging you about 4X a week!</em>'\"</p> \n<p>One strategy that works for Butler is sending daily affirmations to her customers. She started trying out this simple email tactic since her brand's mission is all about not only healing hair but healing beyond the scalp.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Ariel%20Butler%20quote.png?width=1600&amp;name=Ariel%20Butler%20quote.png\" alt=\"Email marketing strategy from Ariel Butler CEO of Shea Ade\" width=\"1600\" style=\"width: 1600px;\"></p> \n<p>\"I want my customers to wake up every day and feel good about how they look,\" Butler said. \"Since I started sending out those emails, I have been completely blown away by how enjoyable daily affirmations have been for my customers. Some people have only been introduced to my brand because someone told them about our emails, and when they found out that Shea Adé is a hair company, they supported me because they resonated with my brand's mission to heal.\"</p> \n<h3>2. Connect with your customers weekly.</h3> \n<p>Every week, Raven Gibson, founder and CEO of <a href=\"https://legendaryrootz.com/collections/shop\">Legendary Rootz</a>, sends out a campaign that allows email subscribers to download a free personal digital wallpaper.</p> \n<p>She says this is her best email marketing strategy, and she coined it \"Wallpaper Wednesday.\" Over the years, Gibson's audience has expressed to her that while they want to support her business, they don't have the funds to do so. She recognized this problem and came up with a free solution to still connect with her community.</p> \n<blockquote> \n <p>\"Typically, the design centers around celebrating Black culture or an important reminder of the day,\" Gibson said. \"This marketing strategy has allowed for our email list to grow, and given us the opportunity to connect with our community.\"</p> \n</blockquote> \n<p>Gibson runs a similar campaign on Tuesdays where she connects with her followers by highlighting their love for natural hair. She sees this as a way to share community and emphasize the importance of Black hair culture. Gibson also uses these emails to share exclusive deals and product restocks specifically for email subscribers.</p> \n<p>These weekly email marketing campaigns have helped drive an excellent return on investment, Gibson said.</p> \n<p>&nbsp;\"Investing in email marketing has allowed us to stretch our marketing dollars while making a meaningful connection with our community,\" Gibson said. &nbsp;</p> \n<h3>3. Launch an engaging outreach campaign.</h3> \n<p>Creating outreach campaigns can grab people's attention while providing a more significant incentive beyond expecting folks to just read your emails.</p> \n<p>Alvarez Mckendall, a serial entrepreneur and digital marketing strategist, is responsible for social media and email marketing at <a href=\"https://realestatebees.com/\">Real Estate Bees</a>, a technology and marketing platform for the real estate industry. One of his most successful email marketing strategies is interviewing the professionals and business owners with which he's trying to connect.</p> \n<p>Mckendall said this strategy is most effective because it helps consumers understand what the business is offering and how potential customers can benefit from it based on what he learns in those interviews.</p> \n<p>Mckendall transformed Real Estate Bees' previous email questionnaire into an interview-style questionnaire and adjusted email templates and subject lines to indicate his company's desire to interview the business owner or a key member instead of completing a boring questionnaire.</p> \n<p>\"Just like your friends and family members, business owners love to get attention and feel important,\" Mckendall said. \"Appealing to one's ego is an extremely effective technique whenever you want to get their attention and start building a business relationship.\"</p> \n<p>When Mckendall launched the outreach campaign, Real Estate Bees' email open rate was 25-27%, and the response rate was about 1%.</p> \n<p>\"I was constantly thinking about how we could improve it,\" he said.</p> \n<p>Based on this campaign, Real Estate Bees' email open rate has improved to 42%, and the response rate increased by 3%. It's essential to make your campaigns engaging by including hyperlinks, photos, videos, and whatever else makes sense for your brand.</p> \n<h3>4. Make allies with other businesses by doing press partnerships.</h3> \n<p>Networking and building partnerships can be handy for email marketing strategies, too. Francis Perdue, CEO of public relations firm <a href=\"https://perdueinc.me/\">Perdue Inc.</a>, suggests Black business owners team up to expand their following by promoting each other.</p> \n<p>The free promotion exposes different audiences to new products and services, and it also helps build community by connecting various consumers.</p> \n<p>\"No money is exchanged, yet it does wonders for your businesses,\" Perdue said. \"Share each other's audiences to support one another. Creating an e-blast for an event or cause for someone in exchange for the same will grow your reach and show that you are committed to the community while promoting unity.\"</p> \n<p>If you don't know where to start, pick up your phone and see what emails you have in your contact list already. When Perdue launched her firm over a decade ago, she said she didn't know many people in the industry, but she had a strong community of friends, old colleagues, and former classmates.</p> \n<p>She did an e-blast to promote her new business, and right off the back, she got 200 subscribers. More than 2,500 people are subscribed to Perdue Inc.'s email list, all of which came from Perdue's organic outreach via her network.</p> \n<p>\"People want to support you; you'd be surprised,\" she said. \"Get out and network. I own a restaurant, so I know the importance of repeat customers.\"</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Francis%20Perdue%20quote.png?width=1600&amp;name=Francis%20Perdue%20quote.png\" alt=\"Email marketing strategy from CEO Francis Perdue\" width=\"1600\" style=\"width: 1600px;\"></p> \n<h3>5. Use tools, applications, and other digital resources.</h3> \n<p>Building email marketing strategies can be tedious and time-consuming, especially if you're</p> \n<p>releasing emails weekly. It's okay to build out your campaigns yourself, but if you're looking for something new or different, here are some tools, applications, and resources that Black business owners use to better connect with their audiences:</p> \n<ul> \n <ul> \n  <li>\"This may sound crazy, but I believe TikTok is an amazing way to drive customers to your brand and your email list.\" — Butler.</li> \n  <li>\"Switching to <a href=\"https://www.klaviyo.com/\">Klaviyo</a>&nbsp;for all email correspondence helped with increasing our abandoned cart click rate from 4% to 7%. I am so happy that I took the time to switch over from Shopify and set it up.\" — Gibson.</li> \n  <li>\"We have been using the <a href=\"https://www.buzzstream.com/\">BuzzStream</a>&nbsp;tool to send out emails and monitor all the analytics and stats.\" — Mckendall.</li> \n  <li>&nbsp;\"I love <a href=\"https://www.adobe.com/products/xd.html\">Adobe XD</a>. It's a prototyping application; however, I use it to craft all of our email marketing collateral. My favorite feature is the ability to duplicate and switch up the content in a split second. After creating specific templates for Wallpaper Wednesday or an exclusive email-only sale, I can reuse them again with just the click of a few buttons. I've found that using these templates allows me to streamline the process immensely.\" — Gibson.</li> \n  <li>\"Some email marketing apps range from $0 to $100 a month. The good news is that usually, under 200 contacts are free. Use <a href=\"https://www.godaddy.com/\">GoDaddy</a>&nbsp;when you start your website to get coupons for marketing from their partners to cut costs as well.\" — Perdue.</li> \n  <li>\"I love the website <a href=\"https://reallygoodemails.com/\">Really Good Emails</a>. It is a gold mine for all things email. The site is very well-organized, and you can find just about any topic within the site. It's almost like the Pinterest of email marketing.\" — Gibson.</li> \n </ul> \n</ul> \n<a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=6496bbfa-2f4e-42ca-aa7c-7e4ee9cffe86&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"black at inbound\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6496bbfa-2f4e-42ca-aa7c-7e4ee9cffe86.png\"></a>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Femail-marketing-black-owned-businesses&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 06 Jul 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"6a35a2d8280138a72c0997cc6d103cff","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Michelai A. Graham","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Dawn%20quote.png?width=1600&name=Dawn%20quote.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn49@2020_5/2021/07/12/18-35-48-739_f641922cba67f3b3.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6cbfefbe-be32-4e0c-9576-d4b6a56dc541.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn12@2020_6/2021/07/12/18-35-52-909_8e0530fa252f2e64.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Ariel%20Butler%20quote.png?width=1600&name=Ariel%20Butler%20quote.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn95@2020_4/2021/07/12/18-35-53-192_9261a8c55bc5d552.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Francis%20Perdue%20quote.png?width=1600&name=Francis%20Perdue%20quote.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn15@2020_5/2021/07/12/18-35-52-290_fe5ba6149838c279.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/6496bbfa-2f4e-42ca-aa7c-7e4ee9cffe86.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn39@2020_3/2021/07/12/18-35-52-147_c05a4b7a8a463334.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Femail-marketing-black-owned-businesses&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn55@2020_2/2021/07/12/18-35-49-561_710ab05c673ac535.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938141},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"What Does it Mean to Use Concatenate in Excel [+ Why It Matters]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/concatenate-excel","description":"<p>Copy and paste shortcuts are handy until you have hundreds of data points to manually combine and reformat.</p> \n<p>Fortunately, you can use the CONCATENATE Excel function to save time (and curb carpal tunnel) when joining information from cells, rows, or columns.</p> \n<p>Meaning \"to join together\" or \"to combine,\" concatenate is a way to unite the contents of two or more cells into one cell.</p> \n<p>The function allows you to combine data from columns, cells, ranges, and rows into whatever format you desire, making it easy to quickly join names and addresses or properly display dates and times.</p> \n<p>There are various ways to set up the CONCATENATE formula in Excel, so we'll walk through the steps required to use this function and achieve your worksheet goals.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=9ff7a4fe-5293-496c-acca-566bc6e73f42&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download 9 Excel Templates for Marketers [Free Kit]\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/9ff7a4fe-5293-496c-acca-566bc6e73f42.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2>How to Concatenate in Excel</h2> \n<p>While there&nbsp;are several ways to combine text in Excel worksheets, we'll be focusing on the CONCATENATE function.</p> \n<p>It combines the contents of two or more cells into one cell without physically changing the shape of the cell and is often used to join pieces of text (called <em>text strings</em>&nbsp;or <em>strings</em>) from individual cells into one cell. The resulting text string is the combination of all strings in your CONCATENATE formula.</p> \n<p>Here's a look at how to concatenate in Excel:</p> \n<p>Let's say you have a list of customers whose first and last names are separate. You need everyone's full names to build a retargeting campaign, so you want to join text from column A (First Name) with the text from column B (Last Name).</p> \n<p>Before using the CONCATENATE function, you have to create a new column for your combined text. In the example below, it's column C (Full Name).</p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20Does%20it%20Mean%20to%20Use%20Concatenate%20in%20Excel,%20+%20Why%20It%20Matters-Jun-30-2021-05-34-06-78-PM.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/excel\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>Now, you're ready to concatenate the first and last names. To do that, you need to understand both the syntax of the function and how to format the text strings that make up the formula.</p> \n<h2>Excel Concatenate Formula</h2> \n<p>Like all Excel functions, the CONCATENATE formula starts with the equals sign (=), followed by the function name, an open parenthesis, and the text arguments. No need to get heated – in this context, arguments simply tell the formula what cells to combine.</p> \n<p><strong>=CONCATENATE(text1, [text2], ...)</strong></p> \n<p><strong>=CONCAT(text1, [text2], ...)</strong></p> \n<p><strong>text1: </strong>This is the first argument to join and can be a number, text, or cell reference.</p> \n<p><strong>text2, text3, etc:</strong>&nbsp;These are the additional items to combine. The CONCATENATE formula can join up to 255 items, with a total of 8,192 characters.</p> \n<p><strong>Note:</strong>&nbsp;In all versions of Excel 2016 and beyond, the CONCATENATE function has been replaced with the <a href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/concat-function-9b1a9a3f-94ff-41af-9736-694cbd6b4ca2\">CONCAT function</a>. This function works in the exact same way, with the added ability to combine text over a range of cells (i.e., =CONCAT(A2:D8)). While you can still access the CONCATENATE function for compatibility reasons, Microsoft warns that CONCATENATE may not be available in future versions of Excel.</p> \n<h2>Excel Concatenate with Space</h2> \n<p>Double quotations (\" \") include a space between the text arguments wherever you want one to appear. Just remember to insert a comma before and after each set of quotations or else an error message will pop up and the formula won't run. You'll know your formula is correct if you hit \"Enter\" and the new text string appears exactly how you want.</p> \n<p>In the name example, you want to combine the text in cells A16 and B16, so add those arguments to the formula. Make sure to place the arguments in the order you want them to appear. To get \"First Name Last Name,\" set up the CONCATENATE formula like this:</p> \n<p><strong>=CONCATENATE((B16, \" \", A16)</strong></p> \n<p><strong>Note: </strong>If at least one of the CONCATENATE function's arguments is invalid, the formula will return a #VALUE! Error.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20Does%20it%20Mean%20to%20Use%20Concatenate%20in%20Excel,%20+%20Why%20It%20Matters.png?width=355&amp;height=320&amp;name=What%20Does%20it%20Mean%20to%20Use%20Concatenate%20in%20Excel,%20+%20Why%20It%20Matters.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\" width=\"355\" height=\"320\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/excel\">Source</a></em></p> \n<p>Now it's time to apply the CONCATENATE formula to every name in the list. Simply hover over the combined cell until a plus sign (+) appears in the bottom right-hand corner. Then click and hold while dragging the cursor down column C, highlighting all of the cells you want to join.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20Does%20it%20Mean%20to%20Use%20Concatenate%20in%20Excel,%20+%20Why%20It%20Matters-2.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/excel\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>When you release the cursor, voila! The formula is applied to each cell. This prevents you from having to type out the formula for each cell by letting you concatenate dozens of text strings in an instant.</p> \n<h2>Excel Concatenate Strings</h2> \n<p>Whether you combine text and numbers, the result of the CONCATENATE function is always a text string. The naming example above is a fairly simple example, but it's possible to create longer, more meaningful text strings in Excel. The key to doing so is to ensure your results provide value to whoever is using the information.</p> \n<p>Let's say you're working on an email campaign and want to personalize the subject line with each customer's name. Instead of manually typing out name after name, you can use the CONCATENATE function to combine the text strings. For this example, I used a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-email-subject-lines-list\">catchy email subject line</a>&nbsp;from Warby Parker.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20Does%20it%20Mean%20to%20Use%20Concatenate%20in%20Excel,%20+%20Why%20It%20Matters-1.png\" style=\"margin-left: 0.00px;\" title=\"\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/excel\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>I write the following formula, making sure to include commas and spaces where I want them to appear.</p> \n<p><strong>=CONCATENATE(B2,\" ,\", A2, \",\",\" \", C2)</strong></p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20Does%20it%20Mean%20to%20Use%20Concatenate%20in%20Excel,%20+%20Why%20It%20Matters-4.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/excel\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>I then apply the formula to the entire column to generate my list of personalized subject lines.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20Does%20it%20Mean%20to%20Use%20Concatenate%20in%20Excel,%20+%20Why%20It%20Matters-Jun-30-2021-05-34-07-41-PM.png\" style=\"margin-left: 0.00px;\" title=\"\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/excel\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>As you experiment with longer text strings, know that every cell reference in the CONCATENATE function must be listed separately because it can't recognize arrays. For instance, your formula should look like =CONCATENATE (B1, B2, B3, B4) rather than =CONCATENATE(B1:B4).</p> \n<p>Combining text is simple enough, but throwing dates and times into the mix can result in a messy formula and error-ridden results.</p> \n<h2>Concatenate Date and Time in Excel</h2> \n<p>You can prevent issues with time and dates by embedding the TEXT function into the CONCATENATE Excel formula. This will let you control the formatting when combining text with a number or a date.</p> \n<p>Let's look at how to combine all of this information. In this worksheet, I want to record the date and time each blog post went live so I can reference the information during my monthly performance analysis.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20Does%20it%20Mean%20to%20Use%20Concatenate%20in%20Excel,%20+%20Why%20It%20Matters-Jun-30-2021-05-34-07-03-PM.png?width=624&amp;name=What%20Does%20it%20Mean%20to%20Use%20Concatenate%20in%20Excel,%20+%20Why%20It%20Matters-Jun-30-2021-05-34-07-03-PM.png\" style=\"margin-left: -5.00px;\" title=\"\" width=\"624\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/excel\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>The formula needed to join these three strings may look complicated, but it's simple once you decide how to format the date and time. I want to leave the dates and times as they are, so I include the date (mm/dd/yyyy)<strong>&nbsp;</strong>and time (hh:mm:ss) formatting into the CONCATENATE formula.</p> \n<p><strong>=CONCATENATE(A2, TEXT(B2,\"mm/dd/yyyy\"), \" at\", \" \",TEXT(C3,\"hh:mm:ss\"))</strong></p> \n<p>The result is a text string that provides meaningful context by sharing what date and time the posts went live.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20Does%20it%20Mean%20to%20Use%20Concatenate%20in%20Excel,%20+%20Why%20It%20Matters-Jun-30-2021-05-34-06-38-PM.png\" style=\"margin-left: 0.00px;\" title=\"\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/excel\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<p>Apply the function to the rest of the worksheet using the same steps as before. Drag the plus (+) sign in the bottom right-hand corner of the combined cell down the column, highlighting the cells you want to concatenate.</p> \n<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/What%20Does%20it%20Mean%20to%20Use%20Concatenate%20in%20Excel,%20+%20Why%20It%20Matters-3.png\" style=\"margin-left: 0.00px;\" title=\"\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/excel\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Source</a></p> \n<h2>Excel Concatenate Range</h2> \n<p>If you're excited about your new Excel skills, you may have the urge to jump in and organize worksheets with thousands of data points. Using the CONCATENATE function can speed up your work, but know that there are limitations.</p> \n<p>Excel only allows you to combine 255 items, up to a total of 8,192 characters, using the CONCATENATE function. So you have to work in sections if you want to create hundreds (or thousands) of new text strings.</p> \n<p>The CONCATENATE function doesn't accept arrays (A3:E5), so make sure to list out each argument you want to include in the formula. If you need to combine a massive range of tens or hundreds of cells, try out one of these shortcuts.</p> \n<p><strong>Use the CONTROL key. </strong></p> \n<ol start=\"1\"> \n <li>Type in the first part of your formula =CONCATENATE(</li> \n <li>Hold down the CONTROL key and select the individual cells you want to combine.</li> \n <li>Release the CONTROL key, type a closing parenthesis, and hit ENTER.</li> \n</ol> \n<p><strong>Use the TRANSPOSE function.</strong></p> \n<p>If you need to combine hundreds of cells, you don't want to waste time clicking on each cell. Instead, use the TRANSPOSE function to create an array before swapping it out with the individual cells.</p> \n<ol start=\"1\"> \n <li>Select the cell you want to use the CONCATENATE function.</li> \n <li>Type in the TRANSPOSE formula to generate an array of cells. It will look similar to this: =TRANSPOSE(A1:A10)</li> \n <li>With the TRANSPOSE cell selected, press the F9 key in the formula bar to replace the array with the individual values to be concatenated.</li> \n <li>Delete the brackets around the values so you're left with only a list.</li> \n <li>Enter the CONCATENATE formula before the values, and close the formula with a parenthesis.</li> \n <li>Hit enter to see your new text string.</li> \n</ol> \n<p>While certain heavy Excel users say the CONCATENATE function is becoming outdated, it's still a useful shortcut for combining text strings without impacting the rest of your worksheet. If you're new to the program, take the time to learn more about <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-use-excel-tips\">how to use Excel</a>&nbsp;and check out these helpful <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/excel-formulas-keyboard-shortcuts\">keyboard shortcuts</a>. You'll be whizzing your way around worksheets and working more efficiently in no time.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=7912de6f-792e-4100-8215-1f2bf712a3e5&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call-to-Action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/7912de6f-792e-4100-8215-1f2bf712a3e5.png\"></a></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fconcatenate-excel&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 30 Jun 2021 17:45:22 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"Scheduling Instagram Posts: Absolutely Everything You Need to Know","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/schedule-instagram-posts-update","description":"<p>Ensuring your Instagram audience sees your content increases chances of engagement, brand awareness, referral traffic, and conversions.</p> \n<p>However,&nbsp; sometimes it's not super efficient for you and your team members to be hovering over your phones or laptops in order to post on Instagram at the exact time you believe you'll be able to get the greatest amount of audience engagement.</p>  \n<p>You may also have other things going on throughout the workday that need to take precedence over opening the Instagram app and clicking \"Post\" on your content.</p> \n<p>This is where <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Instagram scheduling software</span> comes into play.&nbsp;</p> \n<h2>Can you schedule Instagram posts?</h2> \n<p>Yes! Luckily, <a href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2018/01/30/instagram-now-allows-businesses-to-schedule-their-posts/\">Instagram's API</a> lets users of marketing tools like <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/social-inbox\">HubSpot</a> schedule Instagram posts in advance.</p> \n<p>In other words, if you use <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-social-media-management-tools\">social media scheduling software</a>, you can upload your content, choose when it goes live on Instagram, and know that it'll be posted for your audience without you having to lift another finger.</p> \n<p>As mentioned, to start, <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">you'll need a third-party tool to do the scheduling</span>. Below are a few handy options for your consideration.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/social-inboxsch\">HubSpot Social Media Management Software</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: $0/month (Free), $45/month (Starter), $800/month (Professional), $3,200/month (Enterprise)</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%209.36.16%20AM.png?width=600&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%209.36.16%20AM.png\" alt=\"use hubspot to schedule instagram posts ahead of time\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>With HubSpot's Social Media tool, which is part of HubSpot <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing\">Marketing Hub</a>, you can <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/social/create-and-publish-social-posts\">schedule and publish social posts to Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn</a>. From within HubSpot, you can edit your post, schedule it, and add @mentions to tag other accounts and users.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Upload the image that you want to share on Instagram to HubSpot and then drag and drop it into the post that you're scheduling. You can preview the final post prior to it going live so you're able to see exactly what your visitors are going to see.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>After you choose the date and time that your Instagram post will be shared and preview it, tag it with a relevant HubSpot campaign so all of your social posts that are associated with a marketing campaign you're already running are organized.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Once you schedule your post, you can select \"Schedule another\" to plan another social post — there's an option to auto-copy and paste content from the post that you just scheduled so you're able to plan similar posts for different dates, times, and platforms.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Lastly, if you're using HubSpot's social tool to schedule and publish across other platforms, target specific audience groups (for instance, you can target specific countries or languages on Facebook).&nbsp;</p> \n<div> \n <div> \n  <div>  \n   <div> \n    <p><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/social-inbox\"><em>Get HubSpot's Social Media Management Software to help you focus more on connecting with your customers and target audience by using time-saving publishing and scheduling tools that prioritize social interactions.</em></a></p> \n   </div>  \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://later.com/instagram-scheduler/\">Later</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Free, $12.50/mo (Starter), $20.83 (Growth), $33.33 (Advanced)&nbsp;</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%2010.03.08%20AM.png?width=600&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%2010.03.08%20AM.png\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2021-06-23 at 10.03.08 AM\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Later is a social media post scheduler dedicated to Instagram. The platform includes a full social content calendar, drag-and-drop post planning, and the ability to publish automatically to your Instagram Business profile. In addition, the service's <a href=\"https://later.com/linkinbio/\">Linkin.bio</a> feature allows you to link certain posts to specific product pages.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.tailwindapp.com/instagram\">Tailwind</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Free, $9.99/mo (Pro), $19.99 (Advanced), $39.99 (Max)</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%2010.06.17%20AM.png?width=600&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%2010.06.17%20AM.png\" alt=\"tailwind instagram posting and scheduling platform\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Tailwind is a social media scheduler and smart assistant platform specifically for Instagram and Pinterest. Using smart features like bulk image uploading and the built-in Hashtag Finder, the tool allows small businesses to quickly personalize their Instagram posts and get them scheduled.</p> \n<p>The tool also allows you to visually plan and preview your Instagram post schedule and grid via a single dashboard so you can see what your audience will see prior to posting.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://buffer.com/instagram\">Buffer</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: Free, $15/mo (Pro), $65/mo (Premium), $99/mo (Business)&nbsp;</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%2010.14.23%20AM.png?width=600&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%2010.14.23%20AM.png\" alt=\"buffer for instagram to help with scheduling and posting on instagram\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Buffer allows you to schedule social media posts across six social networks: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest, and Google+. Buffer for Instagram makes it easy to manage and schedule your Instagram posts via a single dashboard.</p> \n<p>There's an option to include hashtags in your Instagram post in the Comments section versus in the caption (to keep the post and caption looking as simple as possible). You can also analyze your Instagram posts to determine what worked among your target audience using Buffer's social media analytics feature.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>In addition to a mobile app for iOS and Android, Buffer also offers an extension for your internet browser.</p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://skedsocial.com/features/instagram-story-scheduling-and-auto-posting/\">Sked Social</a></h3> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%2010.23.59%20AM.png?width=600&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%2010.23.59%20AM.png\" alt=\"sked social instagram scheduling software\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<h4>Price: $25/mo (Fundamentals), $75/mo (Essentials), $135/mo (Professional)</h4> \n<p>Sked Social offers an Instagram scheduling and auto-posting tool for Instagram posts and stories. You can plan to automatically post your stories, whether they're photo stories or video stories, using the tool so you never have to intervene or receive reminders to click \"Post\" again.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>You can also schedule your Instagram posts via iOS or Android so you can upload content directly from your mobile device's camera roll.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/\">Sprout Social</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: $99/mo (Standard), $149/mo (Professional), $249/mo (Advanced)</h4> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%2010.33.54%20AM.png?width=600&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-06-23%20at%2010.33.54%20AM.png\" alt=\"sprout social schedule posts to instagram\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></p> \n<p>Sprout Social is a social media management platform that's compatible with six major social networks including Instagram. It has a social media content calendar that allows you to schedule your social posts and then measure different engagement metrics once live.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Easily <a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/insights/how-to-schedule-instagram-posts/\">upload the image you want to post on Instagram</a>, add the caption and other Instagram post details (e.g. location), and then schedule it to go out at the date and time of your choosing.</p> \n<p>The tool's social listening abilities also help you identify unique trends across your Instagram content and then apply these trends to the rest of your Instagram marketing strategy.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://www.loomly.com/\">Loomly</a></h3> \n<h4>Price: $34 /mo (Base), $76 /mo (Standard), $159 /mo (Advanced), $332 /mo (Premium), Contact Us (Enterprise)&nbsp;</h4> \n<p>Loomly is a brand success platform with content management and social media publishing and scheduling features. Schedule your social media posts in advance — there are automated scheduling and publishing options for a variety of social platforms including Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Google. Loomly also offers automated Instagram Ad (and Facebook Ad) publishing.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>With the platform, easily manage your organic and paid social media content — you can also get notifications (via email, Slack, and more) whenever one of your team members works on a piece of social content to make for easy team-wide collaboration. The tool provides social media post recommendations based on trends, events, holidays, and social platform best practices.</p> \n<p>Next, let's dive into how to schedule Instagram posts for an Instagram Business page — for the sake of this post, we'll use HubSpot as our scheduling and publishing tool.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>1. Ensure you have admin access to your Facebook Business Page.</h3> \n<p>Instagram and Facebook might be separate accounts to you personally, but businesses that want to automate their Instagram posting schedule will need to tether both accounts together. So, you'll need the username and password of your business's Facebook account to do this — in other words, head over to the <a href=\"https://business.instagram.com/getting-started\">Instagram Business landing page</a> to set up your account if you don't already have one.</p> \n<h3>2. Switch to your Business profile on the Instagram mobile app and connect this account to Facebook.</h3> \n<p>If you have a personal Instagram account, you probably know you can manage more than one profile from the app — and the other profile is your business account (keep in mind you'll need an Instagram Business account <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/social/connect-your-social-media-accounts-to-hubspot\">to schedule Instagram posts in HubSpot</a>).</p> \n<p>To switch to your Instagram Business page from your personal page, navigate to your profile on your mobile device and tap the three dots in the upper-right corner of your screen. Then, in the next screen, select \"Switch to Business Profile,\" as shown below:</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/instagram-features-tricks\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram-switch-to-business-profile.png?width=250&amp;name=instagram-switch-to-business-profile.png\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 250px;\" alt=\"Switch to Business Profile option on Instagram mobile app\" width=\"250\"></a></p> \n<p>Under \"Settings,\" select \"Linked Accounts.\" Here's where you can select Facebook and link your two accounts together. You might be asked to \"Log in With Facebook,\" at which point you'll enter your business account's username and password. Otherwise, select \"Continue as [yourself].\"</p> \n<h3>3. Open HubSpot and use the \"Social\" tool to integrate your Instagram profile.</h3> \n<p>Now that your Instagram profile is anchored to Facebook, you're ready to integrate it with your post scheduler. As mentioned, for our purposes, we'll be using HubSpot's Social tool.</p> \n<p>Open HubSpot, select \"Settings\" &gt; \"Marketing\" &gt; \"Social\" &gt; \"Connect Account\" &gt; \"Facebook and Instagram.\"</p> \n<h3><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202021-06-24%20at%2011.06.05%20AM.png?width=600&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202021-06-24%20at%2011.06.05%20AM.png\" alt=\"connect social accounts to hubspot\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\"></h3> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Click the first option, \"Facebook &amp; Instagram,\" and follow the prompts to complete this step (<a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/social/connect-your-social-media-accounts-to-hubspot\">which are listed here in greater detail</a>).&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>4. Create your first social post for your Instagram account.</h3> \n<p>Once your Instagram account is integrated into HubSpot, you'll see an option to \"<a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/social/create-and-publish-social-posts\">Create social post</a>\" in your HubSpot dashboard. Click it, and you'll see icons for which social network you want to start with. Select the Instagram icon to compose your first post for your Instagram account.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>5. Compose a message with your desired visual assets, captions, and hashtags.</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/social/create-and-publish-social-posts\">Customize your Instagram post and upload an image</a> using the landscape icons on the bottom-lefthand corner of the white text field that appears, as shown below:</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/product-updates/now-live-publish-to-instagram-directly-from-hubspot\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/compose-instagram-message-hubspot-1.png?width=600&amp;name=compose-instagram-message-hubspot-1.png\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"Box to compose a social post for Instagram via HubSpot\"></a></p> \n<p>Then, caption your image with the text, hashtags, and user mentions you'd like to post your photo with, as they should appear on Instagram.</p> \n<h3>6. Set the date and time of your Instagram post.</h3> \n<p>Just above the photo that you're posting, you'll see a field where you can <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/social/create-and-publish-social-posts\">add the date and time that your post will be scheduled to go live</a>. Use this field to set the exact date and time you want your post to automatically go live on your Instagram profile.</p> \n<h3>7. Preview your post to make sure it looks right.</h3> \n<p>Any grammatical errors? Are all your intended hashtags included? Is the image successfully uploaded? Check to make sure, and you'll be ready to schedule.</p> \n<h3>8. Click \"Schedule message.\"</h3> \n<p>Got any more Instagram posts planned? Draft them now and schedule all of them at the same time — with HubSpot, you can schedule your social posts in bulk.</p> \n<p>Once every post you want to schedule has been loaded into HubSpot, you can hit the \"Schedule\" button on the page.</p> \n<h2>Schedule Your Instagram Posts</h2> \n<p>Start scheduling your Instagram posts to make your workflow more efficient and to ensure the content you need to get in front of your audience does so in a timely fashion.&nbsp;</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in August 2018 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p>
