yreaderx22/cdn27@2020_6/2021/07/12/18-35-52-936_b11b1638981cef20.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/compose-instagram-message-hubspot-1.png?width=600&name=compose-instagram-message-hubspot-1.png":null,"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/b1268983-9da6-4d67-9d3a-cfef2d9f3cff.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn6@2020_2/2021/07/12/18-35-49-299_a4245cc995397db3.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fschedule-instagram-posts-update&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn12@2020_2/2021/07/12/18-35-49-130_68ce747b2cdee10d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938161},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"Best Goal Setting Worksheet to Help You Plan & Achieve","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/goal-setting-worksheet","description":"<p>Accomplishing your goals is an incredibly gratifying feeling.</p>  \n<p>However, it can sometimes be challenging to get that feeling, as achieving your goals takes time, effort, and a structured process. This is why it’s important to create plans of action for meeting the goals that will help you stay motivated and ensure you’re on the right path.</p> \n<p>In this post, we’ll go over a goal-setting worksheet created by HubSpot to help you outline your goals with the SMART framework and create a plan for achieving them. The template is broken down into relevant sections to help you through the process, and if you download it, you can follow along throughout the post.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=a482387e-c9f6-456b-b92f-4ba795780b19&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; margin: 0 auto; display: block; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px\" alt=\"Download your free marketing goal-setting template here.&nbsp;\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/a482387e-c9f6-456b-b92f-4ba795780b19.png\" align=\"middle\"></a></p> \n<h2>Goal Setting Steps</h2> \n<h3>1. Identify your initial goal.</h3> \n<p>The first step of the process is to simply identify what your goal is. It doesn’t have to be convoluted, just merely the objective you’re hoping to achieve. For example, if you’re hoping to grow your website, your baseline goal could be “I want to generate more site traffic.”</p> \n<h3>2.Define your SMART goals.</h3> \n<p>The second step in the process is to use the SMART framework to elaborate your goals to ensure that they’re clear, measurable and that the process will help you get there. Here are is what each of the element in the acronym stands for:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Specific:</strong>&nbsp;A specific goal clearly outlines what you’re hoping to improve. If you share your specific goals with your team, it should be clear what your intention is.</li> \n <li><strong>Measurable:</strong>&nbsp;Making your goal measurable means attaching numbers to your objective that will help you understand what you have to meet, track your progress, and see how long it will take you to reach your end goal.</li> \n <li><strong>Attainable:</strong>&nbsp;Making sure that your goals are attainable means that they are realistic and that you have a chance of achieving them. Your goal is not too out of left field or so unrelated to your current practices that you wouldn’t be able to succeed.</li> \n <li><strong>Relevant:</strong>&nbsp;Ensuring that your goal is relevant involves answering the question of “Why are you setting the goal that you’re setting?” Your goal should directly relate to your business’ needs and help your business grow.</li> \n <li><strong>Time-Bound:</strong>&nbsp;The final aspect of your goal-setting process is to set a timeline. It helps you understand what your schedule should be and stay on track in terms of achieving your ultimate goal.</li> \n</ul> \n<h4>Goal Setting Template</h4> \n<p>It’s always helpful to have a worksheet guide you through your process, and the image below is an example.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-determine-your-smart-marketing-goals?hubs_post-cta=image\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/initial%20goals.jpg?width=2400&amp;name=initial%20goals.jpg\" alt=\"sample goal setting template section for outlining initial goals\" width=\"2400\" style=\"width: 2400px;\"></a><span style=\"font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-determine-your-smart-marketing-goals\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Download Template Here</a></span></p> \n<p>Once you've finished defining your goals, the next step is to calculate your targets so you know what your final numbers should be and so you can plan your process accordingly, so you’re able to meet those final numbers.</p> \n<h3>2. Calculate your goal outcomes.</h3> \n<p>The most challenging part of your plan might be coming up with numerical targets that coincide with achieving your goals. You can just say, “We want to increase blog leads by 25%,” but what would the 25% increase be in numerical form?</p> \n<p>When you have these numbers, you can set milestones for yourself and monitor your progress and make changes along the way if necessary.</p> \n<p>The image below is an example of a SMART goal calculation.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-determine-your-smart-marketing-goals?hubs_post-cta=image\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/add%20numerics.jpg?width=2400&amp;name=add%20numerics.jpg\" alt=\"example template for applying numerical values to your SMART goals\" width=\"2400\" style=\"width: 2400px;\"></a><span style=\"font-size: 13px;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-determine-your-smart-marketing-goals?_ga=2.85371225.1166794584.1622232130-1838590087.1622232130\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></span></p> \n<h3>3. Evaluate your SMART goals.</h3> \n<p>The template’s final step is to evaluate your goals, which helps you anticipate possible roadblocks and develop action plans for dealing with them. If you have multiple goals, aim to ask these questions for each one that you have:</p> \n<ol start=\"1\"> \n <li>What is your SMART marketing goal?</li> \n <li>Do you feel that this goal is realistically attainable in the time frame you’ve set?</li> \n <li>How many hours per week can you dedicate to achieving your goal/your goal process?</li> \n <li>What is the biggest challenge preventing you from achieving this goal? What are possible challenges you may face in achieving this goal? What is the biggest roadblock(s) to achieving this goal?</li> \n <li>What three steps can you take to reduce or remove that challenge and succeed in reaching this goal?</li> \n</ol> \n<p>All in all, following this framework makes your goals explicitly clear for yourself and helps you communicate their importance to all necessary stakeholders, so everyone is on the same page. To get started, <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-determine-your-smart-marketing-goals?_ga=2.47491687.1166794584.1622232130-1838590087.1622232130\">download our template</a>&nbsp;for free and start achieving your goals.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=98f8807c-91d0-4663-ae55-e1f0d07effbd&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"New Call to action\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/98f8807c-91d0-4663-ae55-e1f0d07effbd.png\"></a></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fgoal-setting-worksheet&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 25 Jun 2021 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/a482387e-c9f6-456b-b92f-4ba795780b19.png","linkMd5":"3ac8fbad8e03f3ebda93fafc56bcc300","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn41@2020_3/2021/07/12/18-35-38-384_f9874034bd791f68.webp","destWidth":523,"destHeight":60,"sourceBytes":4586,"destBytes":7842,"author":"fneedle@hubspot.com (Flori Needle)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/a482387e-c9f6-456b-b92f-4ba795780b19.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn41@2020_3/2021/07/12/18-35-38-384_f9874034bd791f68.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/initial%20goals.jpg?width=2400&name=initial%20goals.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn75@2020_6/2021/07/12/18-35-52-626_bc97ffff2b36eec0.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/add%20numerics.jpg?width=2400&name=add%20numerics.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn17@2020_3/2021/07/12/18-35-49-491_d5e8aec19c5767f1.webp","https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/98f8807c-91d0-4663-ae55-e1f0d07effbd.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn54@2020_5/2021/07/12/18-35-52-552_5ac38f911d257768.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fgoal-setting-worksheet&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn55@2020_5/2021/07/12/18-35-52-008_622d1ead5d6145b2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1626114938164},{"createdTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","updatedTime":"2021-07-13 02:35:38","title":"Is SMS Marketing Dead? New Research Says Not Just Yet","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/is-sms-marketing-dead","description":"<p>Whenever I share a screenshot of a friend's funny text on social media, someone always points out the huge number of unread text messages I have.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"iphone upper navigation on text app showing 45 unread messages\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Is%20SMS%20Marketing%20Dead%3F%20New%20Data%20Says%20Maybe%20Not.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\"></p> \n<p>\"Why do you have so many unread texts? And, who are you ignoring?\", my friends often ask.</p> \n<p>The truth is that most of the texts I ignore aren't from actual people. They're usually quick marketing messages that I signed up to receive at some point and ended up forgetting about.</p> \n<p>Whether you signed up for a mobile service, pharmacy alerts, furniture store promos, or another list, you've probably also received a few texts you've either deleted, opted out of, or blatantly ignored.</p> \n<p>With experiences like those above in mind, you might think that SMS marketing is no longer effective. But, in 2021, as people are more attached to their phones than ever before, we might be wrong about the strength of text message promotions.</p> \n<p>As it turns out, a recent study from <a href=\"https://simpletexting.com/2021-texting-statistics/\">SimpleTexting</a>&nbsp;shows that text message marketing might still be alive and well.</p> \n<p>The study, which surveyed over 1300 consumers and marketers, revealed that more than 76% of brands plan to invest in text-message marketing in the next year, while 62% of consumers subscribed to receive texts from at least one brand in the last year.</p> \n<p>Below, we'll dive into the study's research, explain why some marketers might still want to consider SMS strategies, and note a few takeaways for an effective campaign.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=c1b4a8fb-6392-4143-b13c-fc0e3be221e1&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"Free Download: 30 SMS Templates for Marketing, Sales and Customer Success\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/c1b4a8fb-6392-4143-b13c-fc0e3be221e1.png\"></a></p> \n<h2>Why SMS Could Be Coming Back Strong</h2> \n<p>While members of our blogging team once said <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/sms-marketing-misery?_ga=2.1678961.1199474365.1624373729-1356003865.1624373729\">SMS needed to be \"put out of its misery\"</a>&nbsp;due to all the other messaging tactics in the world at the time, no one could have anticipated the changing landscape brought on by COVID-19. During the pandemic, which caused most people to get stuck in their homes, people gravitated to their phones and electronics more than ever, with 76% of consumers reporting increased screentime.</p> \n<p>When it came to texting, 61% of consumers either increased or significantly increased the daily time they spent on their text apps.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"a chart shows that most consumers increased screentime in 2020 during the covid 19 pandemic\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Is%20SMS%20Marketing%20Dead%3F%20New%20Data%20Says%20Maybe%20Not-2.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 10px;\"><em><a href=\"https://simpletexting.com/2021-texting-statistics/\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h2>SMS Marketing Effectiveness in 2021</h2> \n<p>According to <a href=\"https://simpletexting.com/2021-texting-statistics/\">SimpleTexting</a>, 62% of consumers have opted into texts from at least one business while 43% of consumers specifically have subscribed to one to three brands.</p> \n<p>When it comes to text messaging effectiveness, consumers reply to marketing texts that require a response much faster than email. While most people reply to emails within a half-hour to an hour, 72% of consumers respond to texts within 10 minutes.</p> \n<p>Aside from quick response rates, text messages can also receive very high engagement. 43% of surveyed business owners and digital marketers who use SMS marketing report click-through rates between 20% and 35%.</p> \n<p>One interesting piece of the <a href=\"https://simpletexting.com/2021-texting-statistics/\">SimpleTexting</a>&nbsp;survey reveals that 52% of brands reported increased opt-in rates between 2021. However, nearly 10% reported decreased opt-ins in the same year.</p> \n<p>While the increased opt-ins are in line with screen and text-message time increases, the opt-out increases do hint that consumers could be as quick to unsubscribe from text message content as they are to subscribe from it.</p> \n<p>The <a href=\"https://simpletexting.com/2021-texting-statistics/\">SimpleTexting</a> study and other research points to reasons why people might opt out.</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Too many text messages from one brand: </strong>60% of <a href=\"https://simpletexting.com/2021-texting-statistics/\">SimpleTexting</a>&nbsp;respondents say they've unsubscribed from SMS alerts from brands that send them too frequently. Furthermore, 56% of those consumers prefer to receive just one text from a brand per week.</li> \n <li><strong>Too many texts from multiple brands: </strong>If you do up your text cadence to two, keep in mind that your subscribers might be inundated with tons of texts from other brands as well. While your texts might still be meaningful, you might see more sensitivity to opt-outs simply because subscribers are tired of all the text alerts.</li> \n <li><strong>Meaningless content: </strong>Like email marketing, you'll need to hook your reader and keep them engaged with the content they've signed up to receive. Sending too much over-promotional content, boring content, or content that isn't what they signed up for might cause you to see unsubscribes. <strong>&nbsp;</strong></li> \n</ul> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img alt=\"a chart shows that most people unsunscribe from text message alerts because they receive them too often.\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/Is%20SMS%20Marketing%20Dead%3F%20New%20Data%20Says%20Maybe%20Not-1.png\" style=\"margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;\" title=\"\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center; font-size: 10px;\"><em><a href=\"https://simpletexting.com/2021-texting-statistics/\" style=\"font-weight: normal;\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h2>Tips for Launching a Great SMS Strategy</h2> \n<p>While SMS certainly isn't dead, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/conversational-marketing?_ga=2.254005832.1199474365.1624373729-1356003865.1624373729\">text message or conversational marketing platforms</a>&nbsp;can be hard to master. As you consider or build out a text-based strategy, keep these quick tips in mind.</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Know your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/buyer-persona-research\">persona</a>: </strong>Although people might quickly sign up to receive your messages, it won't take much to get them to opt out. Be sure you know exactly what your audience members are looking for and how often they want to receive that content to avoid sending meaningless texts that go ignored.<strong>&nbsp;</strong></li> \n <li><strong>Give subscribers what they've signed up for: </strong>Remember, subscribers are trusting you with their contact information, and if you aren't transparent about what you'll be sending or how often you'll be texting them, they might quickly opt. out. Be sure you stay consistent with what they're expecting. &nbsp;</li> \n <li><strong>Remember, less is more: </strong>No one wants to get their phone blown up with tons of meaningless over-promotional tests. Before you launch an SMS campaign, ask yourself questions like, \"Am I contacting people too often?\" and \"Will they even engage with this content?\" If you worry that the content will be ineffective, consider streamlining your SMS schedule and only sending the most important text content.<strong>&nbsp;</strong></li> \n</ul> \n<p>To learn even more about message-based marketing and SMS strategies, check out the great resource below.</p> \n<p><a class=\"cta_button\" href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/cs/ci/?pg=27a0c42e-ac29-4f9a-8b46-23bf884ee76b&amp;pid=53&amp;ecid=&amp;hseid=&amp;hsic=\"><img class=\"hs-cta-img \" style=\"border-width: 0px; /*hs-extra-styles*/; \" alt=\"SMS Templates for Marketing Sales and Service\" src=\"https://no-cache.hubspot.com/cta/default/53/27a0c42e-ac29-4f9a-8b46-23bf884ee76b.png\"></a></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img
